summary: Everytime [best friends au] Kim Namjoon x female reader Genre: Angst, Fluff Word Count: 10.2k Rating: Mature Warnings: Mentions...
body:
Everytime [best friends au]

Kim Namjoon x female reader

Genre: Angst, Fluff

Word Count: 10.2k

Rating: Mature

Warnings: Mentions of sex, mental health issues, alcohol, swearing.

Description: Helping your best friend and making him happy was always what you strived to achieve. Even if it meant faking to be his girlfriend to get back with his ex, even if it meant his ex was your ex-best friend and even if it meant you were utterly in love with him, trying your best to get over him- or maybe not.

AU: One night I felt motivated and started working on this. Some things are based on my own life, my own feelings, and relationships. I hope I delivered with this story!

[Saturday, 04:53 am]

Your fingers trailed over the black keyboard of your laptop as you typed in meaningless words, saving each and every one on your Word. Your eyes flew to the clock at the bottom of your laptop screen and it read 04:53 am. You sighed at the time and how fast it had passed by, but continued regardless. This was your Saturday night, most of them were like this. Even most of your normal days ended up like this. You sitting on your bed with your laptop on your legs, only the light from the screen illuminating your face, your headphones plugged in to keep any sound away.

A strand of hair fell in the middle of your face and you blew it off only for it to fall back down. You placed it behind your ear and continued your work, only for another distraction to pop up. Your phone buzzed beside you, the screen opening. Your eyes darted to it and as soon as you saw Namjoon’s image displayed, you picked it up, eyebrows scrunched together in confusion.

You just stared at the screen for a mere second, contemplating on whether you should pick up or not. You were already boiling at him having the nerve to call so late at night. Wasn’t he supposed to be at a party right now? You were more than sure he had invited you as well, on Wednesday, and you had turned him down because you were mad at him. It was Jungkook’s party but he would understand. Now Namjoon, on the other hand, was just as pissed as you were, as his own best friend turned him down.

You rolled your eyes and sighed, swiping right. “Hello?”

“Y/N! Babe, finally! What took you so long?” He asked. His voice sounded huskier than usual.

“What do you want?” You asked, coldly.

“Why so harsh? I’m hurt” He said and laughed. “I’m drunk”

“Thanks for telling me? If this is a stupid drunk call, then you’re wasting my time” You told him.

“The boys were asking for you. I’m at the party you were supposed to come, remember?” He said. “But of course, you had better things to do than to hang out with your best friend”

“By hanging out, you mean trying to play matchmaker so that you can get back with Sunmin? No thanks, Joon. I’ll pass this time and all the other times you want me to get her to be jealous for you”  You went off. You knew this wasn’t the right time to talk to him about your thoughts, yet you also knew that you weren’t going to find any courage to do this while he was sober.

“I wanted you here, I invited you, not her. If I wanted to invite her, I would have done it” He said. “Jungkook and Taehyung locked me in a closet”

“They- What? Why?” You asked, laughing.

“Don’t laugh! I can barely see!” He said. “I have no idea”

“Okay, well. Bye” You said, ready to hang up.

“Wait!” He yelled. “Come get me. I’m drunk, remember?”

“You’re not a child. Jin will drive you home” You said.

“I want you! Y/N, my baby girl. Just come to daddy, dammit!” He said.

You chuckled and shut off your laptop. “You are shit drunk, Joon. I’m only coming because you’re stupid when you’re drunk and it doesn’t happen often”

“I are not stupid!” He complained.

“Wow, apparently you forget your grammar too,” You said, putting him on speaker so that you can throw some clothes on. You can’t show up at a party with literally your underwear and a robe around you. You couldn’t give less shit about how you looked, but you didn’t want to go practically naked. Although most of the whores there are naked at this point.

You heard a loud thud from the other line, more than sure Namjoon has hit his head somewhere. Somehow, he is even more clumsy when he is drunk. If you don’t show up in the next twenty minutes, he could even set the closet on fire without knowing how he did it. “I hit my head” He announced as if you hadn’t just heard. “Talk to me!” He whined. “What are you doing?”

“Shut up and stay still. I’m getting dressed to come there” You said.

“Oh,” He said, his tone lower. “You could always come naked, you know? It’s always a sight to see you in your underwear, it will be even better with no clothes. I bet. Wear that dark blue skirt you have, you know, the one that always makes your ass pop even more and has everyone wondering how better it might be exposed”

You almost choked at your own spit at his sudden reveal. You didn’t know people had that opinion for you and what was more surprising was Namjoon’s opinion about you. He’s drunk and talking nonsense, you thought. “You really are a piece of work. And I thought you would be more responsible alone at a party. Usually, I am the one who gets drunk and you are the one who drags me home, you know”

“See what happens when you leave me alone?” He sighed. “I’m useless”

“I told you not to get drunk,” You said, putting your combat boots on. You laced them up and fixed your hair in the mirror, letting your natural soft curls fall down your shoulders- but reaching just there and not longer. You loved having your hair short. It wasn’t exactly a bob and it wasn’t considered long either. The length was just perfect. When you shot the idea that you wanted to cut your hair to your friends, they kept telling you how you should leave your hair get even longer because it suits you. Long dark hair, for a petite curvy figure in her 20s. Fits just right for their stereotypes.

But not for you. You’ve wanted this for so long. You still felt so great about your decision and everyone complimented you despite knowing that they don’t like it as much. It made you feel more like yourself, it gave you a sense of confidence no one could understand but you.

“It’s funny” Namjoon interrupted your train of thoughts. You stopped looking at yourself in the mirror and grabbed your phone from your bed. “It’s funny how you acted all mad when you declined my invite to come to this party, yet you still cared for me enough to tell me not to get drunk. You’re such an idiot, you can’t even hide that you cannot stay mad at me entirely”

You stopped in your tracks and looked at your phone with a grudge as if he could see you from the other side. You opened your mouth to protest against his claim, but you knew nothing you said would be true. He’s drunk, he won’t remember any of what you say tomorrow anyway. “Shut up. I like it more when you are sober because you know how to lie and pretend”

“I’m hungry,” He said.

“I don’t care,” You said and grabbed your keys before stepping out of your apartment to walk to your car. You wrapped your palm around the handle of the driver’s door after unlocking it and opened it, stepping inside. You fastened your seatbelt securely and placed your phone on the passenger’s seat, Namjoon still on speaker. You pressed a few buttons and played your favourite Spotify playlist to drive at night. 

“Ah. There she is. Y/N and her careful driving while listening to music depending on her mood and the time of day” Namjoon said and a small smile formed on your lips at his attention to detail. “I never tell you this, but I’m kind of jealous of how good of a driver you are. So careful, mind set. Yet careless at the same time as you play your music and sing along at times. Sometimes you even sing when we talk on the phone and you think that I can’t listen to you, but I do and damn what I would do to listen to that again and again”

“Oh my god, you know?” You said, facepalming yourself as you drove out of your neighborhood. 

“I do” He laughed drunkenly. “It’s beautiful though. At the other hand, my driving is awful”

“I second that” You laughed. “What I like is that drunk, you are as eager to talk as when you are while sober”

“Girl, I could talk for ages,” He said. “With you especially”

“Mhm,” You said as you turned to a corner. You sighed as you spotted the Taco Bell drive through and drove towards the line. Who are you kidding, there is no line at this time. It’s after 5 am. “Hold on,” You told Namjoon as you pulled at the drive through and placed your finger over the speaker so that he doesn’t hear you order. 

“Hello, what would you like to order?” The man asked from the speaker.

“Hi, can I get three chicken soft tacos, one small fries, one diet coke, and an unsweetened ice tea? Thanks” You ordered and drove a little further. You kept your finger on your speaker until it was time to collect your order and hoped that Namjoon wouldn’t listen. You paid and thanked the cashier quietly, getting no weird looks, surprisingly.

People are too used to drunk teenagers eating at this time. You placed the bag on the passenger’s seat and left your phone right beside it. “Who were you talking to?”

“Nobody”

“Ugh, are you here yet? I’m bored. This party was boring enough without you. Also, I hope nobody saw me wink at Sunmin and then kiss a random girl in beer pong” He giggled.

Your lips formed a straight line as you let the silence fall to collect your thoughts. He kissed a random girl, during a game. You told yourself you were over this stupid crush of yours on your very own guy best friend, yet at the mention of him touching, talking to or kissing another person still made the unsettling feeling in your stomach appear. “I’m almost there. Almost” You sighed.

“Great because I need to pee too,” He said. “What if I pee in this bucket? It fell on me when I hit my head, might as well use it!”

“Namjoon, no!” You said. “Don’t pee in that bucket you asshole”

“But I need to!” He said.

“Do not do it. Jungkook will be pissed” You said.

“As if I care what baby Jungkook thinks,” He said.

“Joonie…” You sighed, knowing how to get him to stop.

“Fine” He groaned and you heard him sit back down on the floor. You parked a few meters away from Jungkook’s apartment and took your seatbelt off. You took your phone in your hand and pressed the middle button for it to open.

“Okay, I’ll be there in a second. Don’t do anything stupid and piss me off more okay?” You told him.

“Yes, ma’am. You behave as well. No touching others, no grinding over anyone’s dick and no sucking anyone’s di-”

“Joon! Shut the hell up and let me come take your drunk ass home” You said and ended the call from the rage that he built so quickly. You got off your car, locked it and put your phone in the pocket of your big jean jacket. You stood in front of the bustling apartment, surprised at the number of people still there. You took in a deep breath and a few thoughts popped in your head.

Why are you doing this? You told yourself you were over with his crap. He has been on and off with you lately and yet acts as if nothing has changed. He has used you as a pawn to get back with his ex-girlfriend, that you got him to date in the first place. He hasn’t had time for you lately either, he has always been hanging out with the boys. You were totally fine with them, you were friends with them as well but he has been making up excuses and canceling plans too many times in the duration of the past three months. And it wasn’t only that, he was still touchy feely with you. Even after he broke up, he likes to play with how you react.

He has let himself turn into who he never wanted to be and you didn’t know the reason why. He wouldn’t tell you and you couldn’t find the courage to talk to him about it either. You were always a confrontatial person, but in his case, he made you feel weak. You felt like putty in his hands, easy to manipulate. You always stood your ground, always went off about what you didn’t like, yet when he smiled at you the way he did, you just held an unexplanable grudge. You would never tell him what it was about and he would easily take it away and charm his way into being as playful and affectionate as always.

He wasn’t a bad friend. He was far from that. He was the perfect friend if that existed. He had his flaws, but the good parts always shined. He was even an amazing person that a lot of people looked up to and you could see why. Yet when you get to know one person, you get to know more of the flaws, the cracks, the insecurities. All of it.

“Yo, Y/N! Jesus christ, how hard are you zoning out?” Jimin laughed at your face as he waved his hand in front of your eyes. 

“Jimin” You let out a breath you didn’t know you were holding. You smiled at the sane sight of your good friend and ex-boyfriend. “Sorry”

“It’s serious if you are zoning out this hard,” He said. “Last time you zoned out like this was when we broke up. Then you broke down, kissed me and smiled like a psycho”

You rolled your eyes at him. “Two years ago. It was a whole two years ago, Jimin”

“What are you doing here? I thought you were too mad at Joon to come” He nudged your shoulder teasingly.

If one person knew you entirely like an open book, it was Jimin. It was admirable how you two never kept secrets. Even with Namjoon, you two weren’t completely transparent. That is how Jimin and Y/N have always been. Raw, honest, stripped down. That’s why your relationship ended so smoothly. You worked better as good friends and you both knew it, so you made the mutual decision. As if it was possible, you became even more close from that day. 

“Yeah well… He called”

“Just like that” He nodded. “Have you really become this soft for him?”

“I guess” You shrugged. “I even brought him food because he said he was hungry,” You said, shaking your head as you looked down at your boots.

“He’s locked in the closet next to Jungkook’s room,” He told you.

“I’m very aware” You nodded and laughed. “Why did they do it?”

“You know how the two babies love to fuck with Joon when he’s drunk. He’s vulnerable. They literally told him that you were in that closet, so he got in and they locked him” He explained. “He really wanted you here” He looked at you, lowering his head so that he can grab your attention and make you stop looking at the ground.

“I don’t care” You shook your head and looked up, swallowing. “I just know that Jin might never get him home if he’s drunk too. He’ll be mad at himself if he doesn’t wake up in his bed tomorrow”

“You don’t care, yet you go out of your way to come all the way across town, almost at dawn to get him home safely,” He said, propping his eyebrow. “Of course you don’t care hun”

“Jiminie I-”

“You know you can’t lie to me” He stated. “You need to tell him how you feel. I know you think it will be stupid and that he will hate you after it, but he’s changed a lot ever since you made that pact to pretend to be his girlfriend so that he can get Sunmin back”

“I don’t even get how people believe it,” You said. “We don’t even kiss!”

“They don’t need to see you kiss to believe it, Y/N. Everyone thought you two were dating from day one, you know that. You know why? Because of that stupid way Joon always looks at you. And I know what you’re going to say. ‘Jimin, those stares only exist in movies and mean absolute shit!’. Well if they happen only in movies, Namjoon is the perfect candidate to play in one because he does it well” He said, trying to change your mind.

“I don’t want to look weak, Jimin,” You said.

He furrowed his eyebrows and shook his head in confusion. “I’m sorry but when did expressing your feelings make you look weak? It makes you honest. I thought you knew how to do that, I thought you were done with being fake”

“I’m not doing it,” You said, crossing your arms in front of your chest. “At least not today. Not until I am sure”

“You will be sure when you end up with seven cats that you will name after us when you turn 70″ He laughed and ruffled your hair. 

“Better late than never” You shrugged.

He rolled his eyes at you and giggled, swinging his arm around your shoulders. He placed a kiss on the top of your head and squeezed you tightly against him in reassurance. “Let’s get you inside. You’re never going to make it upstairs without me. If I let you go alone, you might just end up in a jail cell for punching someone to death”

“Is my hate for drunk teenagers dancing at parties too obvious?” You asked as you took your first steps towards the apartment entrance.

“When you’re sober it is. When you are drunk, you are the annoyance itself’ He teased you with a wide smirk.

“Hey! I like to party, but by my own rules” You said.

“You always are so bossy. Maybe that’s why we didn’t work out. You really do need Joon to dick you down and dom your whiny ass” He smirked harder.

You punched his shoulder and laughed. “I really hate you”

“I love you too, baby!” He yelled over the music.

The moment you walked inside and Jimin released you from his embrace to hold your hand and walk in front of you to protect you, a lot of eyes were definitely on you. Or most likely, your bottom half. You really went the route of wearing the skirt Joon told you to wear just to mess him up a little. We never talked about me anymore and I had to take care of myself on my own. But I also got so obsessed with playing your girlfriend and making sure you were happy that I forgot what I actually wanted”

“I’m sorry,” He said. “It’s worse than you think it is, Y/N. I- Sunmin just helped me open my eyes but you know that sometimes I get lost too. Sometimes I am selfish and put myself first. I thought that if I got back with her maybe everything would be normal again”

“You should have told me, Namjoon. You know for a fact that just because I have depression, just because I used to want to end it all doesn’t mean I am some delicate flower. You can talk to me. You can tell me how you feel” You said. “I am even more mad at you for not opening up”

“If I talked to you, I would have lost you” He shook his head. “I saw how eager you were into helping me get Sunmin back, I got it as a message that that is all you wanted. For me to date someone else. I kind of used you in a way. I did initially want Sunmin back but falling into the routine of acting as if we were together felt good and for a moment I forgot about her. It felt… refreshing to not be suffocated with the thought of her. Because that’s how it feels when I’m with you. You know that feeling? When sometimes, when things are a certain way, it feels as if everything has fallen into place?”

“I know how it feels” You nodded. “I just don’t think you are healthy for me anymore, Namjoon. Jimin thinks that too. Everyone can see it, besides you”

“Can see what?” He asked, clueless over the fact that you are head over heels for your own best friend.

“That-” You took in a deep breath. “Jimin told me… He told me that everyone can see how we feel about one another but us. He said you have that ‘look’ on your face. That look someone has when they are whipped for someone. The look that always makes you smile when we watch KDramas together. When the guy looks at the girl with hearts in his eyes or whatever”

He laughed lightly and nodded, licking his lips. “Do I?”

“How can I know?! I’m just a naive girl that- never mind. Let’s leave it at that” You said.

“I want to change something in our rules for the pact,” He said, clearing his throat. The moment you thought he understood you, he brought up the pact again.

“You… What?”

“I want to erase the no kissing rule,” He said.

“Why?” Your eyes widened.

“I want to know…” He took a step further. “I want to confirm how whipped I am” He smiled cheekily. His dimples popped, perfectly carved into both of his cheeks as always. He held your chin with his index finger and as your eyes were locked on his lips, you forgot what he even told you. 

“Okay stop” You shook your head, seeing as this was getting out of hand. “You can’t be touching me like this anymore!”

“What? Like what? Did you hear what I told you?” He asked.

“Like - like we’re an item! Or you can’t look at me like you want to undress me and eat me for dessert. And when I told you I don’t want you drunk around me anymore, I meant it! You told me you wanted to see me naked and you can’t do that!” You started stomping up and down in front of him, trying to shake away the thought of his lips. His lips on your neck, his hand on your thigh, his eyes sinking into yours and your skin melting under his fingertips. “I’m supposed to be getting over you!”

Namjoon raised his brows and laughed. “Did you just think out loud?”

“I- I- No!” You shook your head. “I’m playing the fake girlfriend” You lied. “As the fake girlfriend, I think you are a bad kisser so I don’t want to kiss you”

“You know, Jimin is right. We’re goddamn blind and in your case, you are deaf too” He said. Namjoon took your hands and stopped you in front of him for what seemed like the tenth time today.

“Excuse you! My senses are great!”

“Yet when I told you I want to see how whipped I am for you, you hear nothing” He giggled.

Your lips parted and you looked at him dumbfounded. “Uh… what? Pft! Of course, I heard that. God, you’re such a good actor”

“God Y/N, stop it” He shook his head. “Answer this question for me. Why in the world, when you have all you want in front of you, you just let it go? You always put others first. Be a little selfish and kiss me”

For a moment you thought you were hallucinating for real. You thought you were dreaming or reading one of your own awful works. But it was him, right in front of you, asking you to break the number one rule you had set months ago. You’ve never wanted to be a rebel more in your life and you took your chance. You grabbed the collar of his shirt and crashed his lips against yours. You stood on your tip toes, the height difference between the two of you immense. A smile formed on Namjoon’s lips but it didn’t break the kiss, it even made it better.

He grabbed your waist and lifted you up. You wrapped your legs around his waist and he secured you by pushing you against the maroon brick wall. It is one thing to imagine how kissing him would feel like and another how it actually felt in reality. No, kissing him didn’t seem like a dream. It felt like it completed all that has been happening for years now. Like it justified how you acted with one another.

You smiled throughout the kiss and were eventually the one to break it, as you giggled from the fact that Namjoon had to lift you up so you could kiss. “I’m sorry! I couldn’t help it. Jesus Christ, I can’t even reach your face Joon!”

“You’re tiny and I love it” He smirked.

“Hey!” You pouted. “Don’t act as if this saved everything. You have a lot to make up for”

“Mhm. I know” He said. “But I have four days of you to myself to fix it since you don’t have to go to work” His lips pulled into a cheeky grin and you playfully smacked his arm.

“You’re unbelievable,” You said. He looked down at you, caressing your cheek with his thumb. He placed a strand of hair behind your ear and his eyes traveled towards your neck.

“Ha. Seems like the hickey I gave you wasn’t that bad anyway. I should make up for that” He said.

Your eyes widened at his words. How did he know that he gave you a hickey? “Did- How do you remember?”

“Let’s just say that all I did after we ate, was of my own accord”

[Saturday, 04:53 am]

Your fingers trailed over the black keyboard of your laptop as you typed in meaningless words, saving each and every one on your Word. Your eyes flew to the clock at the bottom of your laptop screen and it read 04:53 am. You sighed at the time and how fast it had passed by, but continued regardless. This was your Saturday night, most of them were like this. Even most of your normal days ended up like this. You sitting on your bed with your laptop on your legs, only the light from the screen illuminating your face, your headphones plugged in to keep any sound away.

[[MORE]]

A strand of hair fell in the middle of your face and you blew it off only for it to fall back down. You placed it behind your ear and continued your work, only for another distraction to pop up. Your phone buzzed beside you, the screen opening. Your eyes darted to it and as soon as you saw Namjoon’s image displayed, you picked it up, eyebrows scrunched together in confusion.

You just stared at the screen for a mere second, contemplating on whether you should pick up or not. You were already boiling at him having the nerve to call so late at night. Wasn’t he supposed to be at a party right now? You were more than sure he had invited you as well, on Wednesday, and you had turned him down because you were mad at him. It was Jungkook’s party but he would understand. Now Namjoon, on the other hand, was just as pissed as you were, as his own best friend turned him down.

You rolled your eyes and sighed, swiping right. “Hello?”

“Y/N! Babe, finally! What took you so long?” He asked. His voice sounded huskier than usual.

“What do you want?” You asked, coldly.

“Why so harsh? I’m hurt” He said and laughed. “I’m drunk”

“Thanks for telling me? If this is a stupid drunk call, then you’re wasting my time” You told him.

“The boys were asking for you. I’m at the party you were supposed to come, remember?” He said. “But of course, you had better things to do than to hang out with your best friend”

“By hanging out, you mean trying to play matchmaker so that you can get back with Sunmin? No thanks, Joon. I’ll pass this time and all the other times you want me to get her to be jealous for you”  You went off. You knew this wasn’t the right time to talk to him about your thoughts, yet you also knew that you weren’t going to find any courage to do this while he was sober.

“I wanted you here, I invited you, not her. If I wanted to invite her, I would have done it” He said. “Jungkook and Taehyung locked me in a closet”

“They- What? Why?” You asked, laughing.

“Don’t laugh! I can barely see!” He said. “I have no idea”

“Okay, well. Bye” You said, ready to hang up.

“Wait!” He yelled. “Come get me. I’m drunk, remember?”

“You’re not a child. Jin will drive you home” You said.

“I want you! Y/N, my baby girl. Just come to daddy, dammit!” He said.

You chuckled and shut off your laptop. “You are shit drunk, Joon. I’m only coming because you’re stupid when you’re drunk and it doesn’t happen often”

“I are not stupid!” He complained.

“Wow, apparently you forget your grammar too,” You said, putting him on speaker so that you can throw some clothes on. You can’t show up at a party with literally your underwear and a robe around you. You couldn’t give less shit about how you looked, but you didn’t want to go practically naked. Although most of the whores there are naked at this point.

You heard a loud thud from the other line, more than sure Namjoon has hit his head somewhere. Somehow, he is even more clumsy when he is drunk. If you don’t show up in the next twenty minutes, he could even set the closet on fire without knowing how he did it. “I hit my head” He announced as if you hadn’t just heard. “Talk to me!” He whined. “What are you doing?”

“Shut up and stay still. I’m getting dressed to come there” You said.

“Oh,” He said, his tone lower. “You could always come naked, you know? It’s always a sight to see you in your underwear, it will be even better with no clothes. I bet. Wear that dark blue skirt you have, you know, the one that always makes your ass pop even more and has everyone wondering how better it might be exposed”

You almost choked at your own spit at his sudden reveal. You didn’t know people had that opinion for you and what was more surprising was Namjoon’s opinion about you. He’s drunk and talking nonsense, you thought. “You really are a piece of work. And I thought you would be more responsible alone at a party. Usually, I am the one who gets drunk and you are the one who drags me home, you know”

“See what happens when you leave me alone?” He sighed. “I’m useless”

“I told you not to get drunk,” You said, putting your combat boots on. You laced them up and fixed your hair in the mirror, letting your natural soft curls fall down your shoulders- but reaching just there and not longer. You loved having your hair short. It wasn’t exactly a bob and it wasn’t considered long either. The length was just perfect. When you shot the idea that you wanted to cut your hair to your friends, they kept telling you how you should leave your hair get even longer because it suits you. Long dark hair, for a petite curvy figure in her 20s. Fits just right for their stereotypes.

But not for you. You’ve wanted this for so long. You still felt so great about your decision and everyone complimented you despite knowing that they don’t like it as much. It made you feel more like yourself, it gave you a sense of confidence no one could understand but you.

“It’s funny” Namjoon interrupted your train of thoughts. You stopped looking at yourself in the mirror and grabbed your phone from your bed. “It’s funny how you acted all mad when you declined my invite to come to this party, yet you still cared for me enough to tell me not to get drunk. You’re such an idiot, you can’t even hide that you cannot stay mad at me entirely”

You stopped in your tracks and looked at your phone with a grudge as if he could see you from the other side. You opened your mouth to protest against his claim, but you knew nothing you said would be true. He’s drunk, he won’t remember any of what you say tomorrow anyway. “Shut up. I like it more when you are sober because you know how to lie and pretend”

“I’m hungry,” He said.

“I don’t care,” You said and grabbed your keys before stepping out of your apartment to walk to your car. You wrapped your palm around the handle of the driver’s door after unlocking it and opened it, stepping inside. You fastened your seatbelt securely and placed your phone on the passenger’s seat, Namjoon still on speaker. You pressed a few buttons and played your favourite Spotify playlist to drive at night. 

“Ah. There she is. Y/N and her careful driving while listening to music depending on her mood and the time of day” Namjoon said and a small smile formed on your lips at his attention to detail. “I never tell you this, but I’m kind of jealous of how good of a driver you are. So careful, mind set. Yet careless at the same time as you play your music and sing along at times. Sometimes you even sing when we talk on the phone and you think that I can’t listen to you, but I do and damn what I would do to listen to that again and again”

“Oh my god, you know?” You said, facepalming yourself as you drove out of your neighborhood. 

“I do” He laughed drunkenly. “It’s beautiful though. At the other hand, my driving is awful”

“I second that” You laughed. “What I like is that drunk, you are as eager to talk as when you are while sober”

“Girl, I could talk for ages,” He said. “With you especially”

“Mhm,” You said as you turned to a corner. You sighed as you spotted the Taco Bell drive through and drove towards the line. Who are you kidding, there is no line at this time. It’s after 5 am. “Hold on,” You told Namjoon as you pulled at the drive through and placed your finger over the speaker so that he doesn’t hear you order. 

“Hello, what would you like to order?” The man asked from the speaker.

“Hi, can I get three chicken soft tacos, one small fries, one diet coke, and an unsweetened ice tea? Thanks” You ordered and drove a little further. You kept your finger on your speaker until it was time to collect your order and hoped that Namjoon wouldn’t listen. You paid and thanked the cashier quietly, getting no weird looks, surprisingly.

People are too used to drunk teenagers eating at this time. You placed the bag on the passenger’s seat and left your phone right beside it. “Who were you talking to?”

“Nobody”

“Ugh, are you here yet? I’m bored. This party was boring enough without you. Also, I hope nobody saw me wink at Sunmin and then kiss a random girl in beer pong” He giggled.

Your lips formed a straight line as you let the silence fall to collect your thoughts. He kissed a random girl, during a game. You told yourself you were over this stupid crush of yours on your very own guy best friend, yet at the mention of him touching, talking to or kissing another person still made the unsettling feeling in your stomach appear. “I’m almost there. Almost” You sighed.

“Great because I need to pee too,” He said. “What if I pee in this bucket? It fell on me when I hit my head, might as well use it!”

“Namjoon, no!” You said. “Don’t pee in that bucket you asshole”

“But I need to!” He said.

“Do not do it. Jungkook will be pissed” You said.

“As if I care what baby Jungkook thinks,” He said.

“Joonie…” You sighed, knowing how to get him to stop.

“Fine” He groaned and you heard him sit back down on the floor. You parked a few meters away from Jungkook’s apartment and took your seatbelt off. You took your phone in your hand and pressed the middle button for it to open.

“Okay, I’ll be there in a second. Don’t do anything stupid and piss me off more okay?” You told him.

“Yes, ma’am. You behave as well. No touching others, no grinding over anyone’s dick and no sucking anyone’s di-”

“Joon! Shut the hell up and let me come take your drunk ass home” You said and ended the call from the rage that he built so quickly. You got off your car, locked it and put your phone in the pocket of your big jean jacket. You stood in front of the bustling apartment, surprised at the number of people still there. You took in a deep breath and a few thoughts popped in your head.

Why are you doing this? You told yourself you were over with his crap. He has been on and off with you lately and yet acts as if nothing has changed. He has used you as a pawn to get back with his ex-girlfriend, that you got him to date in the first place. He hasn’t had time for you lately either, he has always been hanging out with the boys. You were totally fine with them, you were friends with them as well but he has been making up excuses and canceling plans too many times in the duration of the past three months. And it wasn’t only that, he was still touchy feely with you. Even after he broke up, he likes to play with how you react.

He has let himself turn into who he never wanted to be and you didn’t know the reason why. He wouldn’t tell you and you couldn’t find the courage to talk to him about it either. You were always a confrontatial person, but in his case, he made you feel weak. You felt like putty in his hands, easy to manipulate. You always stood your ground, always went off about what you didn’t like, yet when he smiled at you the way he did, you just held an unexplanable grudge. You would never tell him what it was about and he would easily take it away and charm his way into being as playful and affectionate as always.

He wasn’t a bad friend. He was far from that. He was the perfect friend if that existed. He had his flaws, but the good parts always shined. He was even an amazing person that a lot of people looked up to and you could see why. Yet when you get to know one person, you get to know more of the flaws, the cracks, the insecurities. All of it.

“Yo, Y/N! Jesus christ, how hard are you zoning out?” Jimin laughed at your face as he waved his hand in front of your eyes. 

“Jimin” You let out a breath you didn’t know you were holding. You smiled at the sane sight of your good friend and ex-boyfriend. “Sorry”

“It’s serious if you are zoning out this hard,” He said. “Last time you zoned out like this was when we broke up. Then you broke down, kissed me and smiled like a psycho”

You rolled your eyes at him. “Two years ago. It was a whole two years ago, Jimin”

“What are you doing here? I thought you were too mad at Joon to come” He nudged your shoulder teasingly.

If one person knew you entirely like an open book, it was Jimin. It was admirable how you two never kept secrets. Even with Namjoon, you two weren’t completely transparent. That is how Jimin and Y/N have always been. Raw, honest, stripped down. That’s why your relationship ended so smoothly. You worked better as good friends and you both knew it, so you made the mutual decision. As if it was possible, you became even more close from that day. 

“Yeah well… He called”

“Just like that” He nodded. “Have you really become this soft for him?”

“I guess” You shrugged. “I even brought him food because he said he was hungry,” You said, shaking your head as you looked down at your boots.

“He’s locked in the closet next to Jungkook’s room,” He told you.

“I’m very aware” You nodded and laughed. “Why did they do it?”

“You know how the two babies love to fuck with Joon when he’s drunk. He’s vulnerable. They literally told him that you were in that closet, so he got in and they locked him” He explained. “He really wanted you here” He looked at you, lowering his head so that he can grab your attention and make you stop looking at the ground.

“I don’t care” You shook your head and looked up, swallowing. “I just know that Jin might never get him home if he’s drunk too. He’ll be mad at himself if he doesn’t wake up in his bed tomorrow”

“You don’t care, yet you go out of your way to come all the way across town, almost at dawn to get him home safely,” He said, propping his eyebrow. “Of course you don’t care hun”

“Jiminie I-”

“You know you can’t lie to me” He stated. “You need to tell him how you feel. I know you think it will be stupid and that he will hate you after it, but he’s changed a lot ever since you made that pact to pretend to be his girlfriend so that he can get Sunmin back”

“I don’t even get how people believe it,” You said. “We don’t even kiss!”

“They don’t need to see you kiss to believe it, Y/N. Everyone thought you two were dating from day one, you know that. You know why? Because of that stupid way Joon always looks at you. And I know what you’re going to say. ‘Jimin, those stares only exist in movies and mean absolute shit!’. Well if they happen only in movies, Namjoon is the perfect candidate to play in one because he does it well” He said, trying to change your mind.

“I don’t want to look weak, Jimin,” You said.

He furrowed his eyebrows and shook his head in confusion. “I’m sorry but when did expressing your feelings make you look weak? It makes you honest. I thought you knew how to do that, I thought you were done with being fake”

“I’m not doing it,” You said, crossing your arms in front of your chest. “At least not today. Not until I am sure”

“You will be sure when you end up with seven cats that you will name after us when you turn 70″ He laughed and ruffled your hair. 

“Better late than never” You shrugged.

He rolled his eyes at you and giggled, swinging his arm around your shoulders. He placed a kiss on the top of your head and squeezed you tightly against him in reassurance. “Let’s get you inside. You’re never going to make it upstairs without me. If I let you go alone, you might just end up in a jail cell for punching someone to death”

“Is my hate for drunk teenagers dancing at parties too obvious?” You asked as you took your first steps towards the apartment entrance.

“When you’re sober it is. When you are drunk, you are the annoyance itself’ He teased you with a wide smirk.

“Hey! I like to party, but by my own rules” You said.

“You always are so bossy. Maybe that’s why we didn’t work out. You really do need Joon to dick you down and dom your whiny ass” He smirked harder.

You punched his shoulder and laughed. “I really hate you”

“I love you too, baby!” He yelled over the music.

The moment you walked inside and Jimin released you from his embrace to hold your hand and walk in front of you to protect you, a lot of eyes were definitely on you. Or most likely, your bottom half. You really went the route of wearing the skirt Joon told you to wear just to mess him up a little. You received a few quick greetings from Hoseok and Yoongi, Hoseok drunk dancing on top of the coffee table in the living room along with Jin and Jimin helped you pass through the crowd to walk into the kitchen where he knew Jungkook and Taehyung would be, filling up their cups with more alcohol.

As soon as Jimin released his grip from your hand and you walked in front of your two friends, they stopped drinking, their eyes as wide as an owl’s. “Which one of you fuckers had the brilliant idea?”

Jungkook gulped down and stuttered. “I- I uh I didn’t! It was Taehyung!”

“Liar!” Taehyung exlcaimed and hit Jungkook on his chest. “It was your idea. I don’t want my balls cut off by Y/N. I want to have chldren. You’re doomed to never find a wife, I’m not!”

“You’re such an asshole, I swear to god” Jungkook rolled his eyes at Taehyung. As amusing as it was to hear them argue, trying to cover up their little plan, you wanted to get to the point.

“How long has it been?” You asked.

“An hour? I think more. He might have died” Jungkook said.

“Well, you’re a dick and it is a proven fact from now on. Brilliant idea, never do it without me again. But do it for a good reason!” You protested. “You can’t go around and push my relationship with Joon like that. It’s uncalled for”

“We just wanted to fuck with him, I’m sorry” Jungkook pouted.

“Next time you want to know something about us two, just ask me and don’t manipulate Joon. Because I know you did it to prove a point” You said.

“Which is that Joon wants your babies,” Taehyung said. “He called you, mission accomplished. Just date for real, it’s tiring”

“You think it’s not tiring for me either?!” You yelled out of frustration. “I’m sorry. I’m not having the best day. He was rambling on the phone and I don’t know what to believe anymore. I’m going to go get him”

“Relax. You’re just taking him home” Jimin said as you walked out of the kitchen.

“I know” You let out a sigh. “You can go now” You smiled at him.

“Text me if anything happens” He kissed your cheek one last time and left you be.

You took in a deep breath and quickly walked up the stairs. Namjoon was the only one that hadn’t noticed your feelings at this point. Every one of the boys and your girl friends knew. They were also the only people that knew your relationship was just staged. He was such a smart person, his intelligence and his way of understanding everyone around him was admirable, nevertheless, he couldn’t decipher your mind entirely and it drove you insane. You just wished he could see it with his own eyes, make his conclusion and ask you if it is true. The thought of uttering those words to him was simply terrifying.

Your feet navigated you through the apartment and you knew exactly where that closet was. You remember back a year ago when you were at another party of Jungkook’s. You played Seven Minutes In Heaven. Even if you found it childish, the two vodkas and one shot of tequila in your system, told your brain it would be fun. Namjoon and Hoseok had sent you and Jimin inside this closet because they thought it was a bad idea that you two broke up. You remember Hoseok’s words exactly. ‘Come on you idiots, you still undress each other with those eyes!’

Drunk Hoseok never makes sense, you thought. You giggled at the memory of you and Jimin walking inside, being locked in and ending up cracking up. You wanted to make the others think you were actually making out, so you threw a few moans and names here and there. Both of you were sure most of the people playing the game would have their ears on the wood of the door to listen to what was going on. Unfortunately, you blew your plan when Jimin started tickling you and you started laughing hysterically.

The corners of your lips curled up into a small smile, however, it quickly fell off your pink stained lips and formed a small frown as you prepared yourself to unlock the door to the closet. You had to do this and you had to be cold and quick with it. No having fun, there are limits in your actions. At least there should be, even if you keep them or not.

You twisted the golden key Jungkook had given you and unlocked the door, opening it slowly. You turned the lights on, which were off the whole time and Namjoon squinted his eyes, hissing. “Ouch!”

“Get up,” You told him, your arms crossed in front of your chest.

He opened his eyes and stood up carefully, his palm on the wall to help him steady his vulnerable drunken state. “You took your sweet time coming here”

Your eyes widened as you realized, his hair was no longer black. His smooth black hair has suddenly become a dirty blond colour, which somehow complimented his recently tanned skin tone perfectly. “You- You’re blond?”

“You like it?” He grinned widely. “We made a bet with the guys! So I did it”

“I swear to God, you are such an idiot” You rolled your eyes and breathed in, taking a whiff of a terrible smell. You squinted your eyes in disgust and pinched your nose with your index finger and your thumb. “What is that smell?”

“As I said, you took your sweet time. I couldn’t hold it back any longer!” He whined.

“Oh my god, did you seriously pee in the bucket?” You asked, surprised.

“Wanna see?” He asked.

“No!” You shook your head. “Let’s just get out of here. The ones who started this mess in the first place can handle it”

Namjoon giggled and as soon as he walked out, you locked the closet again and pushed Namjoon towards the bathroom across the hall. “First you clean your hands and then we can leave”

“You act worse than my mother, Jesus Y/N” He rolled his eyes. He did as you said and proceeded to clean his face with some water. Surprisingly enough, he could walk perfectly even if he is drunk. Maybe, just maybe the alcohol was starting to wear off of him.

“Ha. Seems like the hickey I gave you wasn’t that bad anyway. I should make up for that” He said.

Your eyes widened at his words. How did he know that he gave you a hickey? “Did- How do you remember?”

“Let’s just say that all I did after we ate, was of my own accord”

[Saturday, 04:53 am]

Your fingers trailed over the black keyboard of your laptop as you typed in meaningless words, saving each and every one on your Word. Your eyes flew to the clock at the bottom of your laptop screen and it read 04:53 am. You sighed at the time and how fast it had passed by, but continued regardless. This was your Saturday night, most of them were like this. Even most of your normal days ended up like this. You sitting on your bed with your laptop on your legs, only the light from the screen illuminating your face, your headphones plugged in to keep any sound away.

[[MORE]]

A strand of hair fell in the middle of your face and you blew it off only for it to fall back down. You placed it behind your ear and continued your work, only for another distraction to pop up. Your phone buzzed beside you, the screen opening. Your eyes darted to it and as soon as you saw Namjoon’s image displayed, you picked it up, eyebrows scrunched together in confusion.

You just stared at the screen for a mere second, contemplating on whether you should pick up or not. You were already boiling at him having the nerve to call so late at night. Wasn’t he supposed to be at a party right now? You were more than sure he had invited you as well, on Wednesday, and you had turned him down because you were mad at him. It was Jungkook’s party but he would understand. Now Namjoon, on the other hand, was just as pissed as you were, as his own best friend turned him down.

You rolled your eyes and sighed, swiping right. “Hello?”

“Y/N! Babe, finally! What took you so long?” He asked. His voice sounded huskier than usual.

“What do you want?” You asked, coldly.

“Why so harsh? I’m hurt” He said and laughed. “I’m drunk”

“Thanks for telling me? If this is a stupid drunk call, then you’re wasting my time” You told him.

“The boys were asking for you. I’m at the party you were supposed to come, remember?” He said. “But of course, you had better things to do than to hang out with your best friend”

“By hanging out, you mean trying to play matchmaker so that you can get back with Sunmin? No thanks, Joon. I’ll pass this time and all the other times you want me to get her to be jealous for you”  You went off. You knew this wasn’t the right time to talk to him about your thoughts, yet you also knew that you weren’t going to find any courage to do this while he was sober.

“I wanted you here, I invited you, not her. If I wanted to invite her, I would have done it” He said. “Jungkook and Taehyung locked me in a closet”

“They- What? Why?” You asked, laughing.

“Don’t laugh! I can barely see!” He said. “I have no idea”

“Okay, well. Bye” You said, ready to hang up.

“Wait!” He yelled. “Come get me. I’m drunk, remember?”

“You’re not a child. Jin will drive you home” You said.

“I want you! Y/N, my baby girl. Just come to daddy, dammit!” He said.

You chuckled and shut off your laptop. “You are shit drunk, Joon. I’m only coming because you’re stupid when you’re drunk and it doesn’t happen often”

“I are not stupid!” He complained.

“Wow, apparently you forget your grammar too,” You said, putting him on speaker so that you can throw some clothes on. You can’t show up at a party with literally your underwear and a robe around you. You couldn’t give less shit about how you looked, but you didn’t want to go practically naked. Although most of the whores there are naked at this point.

You heard a loud thud from the other line, more than sure Namjoon has hit his head somewhere. Somehow, he is even more clumsy when he is drunk. If you don’t show up in the next twenty minutes, he could even set the closet on fire without knowing how he did it. “I hit my head” He announced as if you hadn’t just heard. “Talk to me!” He whined. “What are you doing?”

“Shut up and stay still. I’m getting dressed to come there” You said.

“Oh,” He said, his tone lower. “You could always come naked, you know? It’s always a sight to see you in your underwear, it will be even better with no clothes. I bet. Wear that dark blue skirt you have, you know, the one that always makes your ass pop even more and has everyone wondering how better it might be exposed”

You almost choked at your own spit at his sudden reveal. You didn’t know people had that opinion for you and what was more surprising was Namjoon’s opinion about you. He’s drunk and talking nonsense, you thought. “You really are a piece of work. And I thought you would be more responsible alone at a party. Usually, I am the one who gets drunk and you are the one who drags me home, you know”

“See what happens when you leave me alone?” He sighed. “I’m useless”

“I told you not to get drunk,” You said, putting your combat boots on. You laced them up and fixed your hair in the mirror, letting your natural soft curls fall down your shoulders- but reaching just there and not longer. You loved having your hair short. It wasn’t exactly a bob and it wasn’t considered long either. The length was just perfect. When you shot the idea that you wanted to cut your hair to your friends, they kept telling you how you should leave your hair get even longer because it suits you. Long dark hair, for a petite curvy figure in her 20s. Fits just right for their stereotypes.

But not for you. You’ve wanted this for so long. You still felt so great about your decision and everyone complimented you despite knowing that they don’t like it as much. It made you feel more like yourself, it gave you a sense of confidence no one could understand but you.

“It’s funny” Namjoon interrupted your train of thoughts. You stopped looking at yourself in the mirror and grabbed your phone from your bed. “It’s funny how you acted all mad when you declined my invite to come to this party, yet you still cared for me enough to tell me not to get drunk. You’re such an idiot, you can’t even hide that you cannot stay mad at me entirely”

You stopped in your tracks and looked at your phone with a grudge as if he could see you from the other side. You opened your mouth to protest against his claim, but you knew nothing you said would be true. He’s drunk, he won’t remember any of what you say tomorrow anyway. “Shut up. I like it more when you are sober because you know how to lie and pretend”

“I’m hungry,” He said.

“I don’t care,” You said and grabbed your keys before stepping out of your apartment to walk to your car. You wrapped your palm around the handle of the driver’s door after unlocking it and opened it, stepping inside. You fastened your seatbelt securely and placed your phone on the passenger’s seat, Namjoon still on speaker. You pressed a few buttons and played your favourite Spotify playlist to drive at night. 

“Ah. There she is. Y/N and her careful driving while listening to music depending on her mood and the time of day” Namjoon said and a small smile formed on your lips at his attention to detail. “I never tell you this, but I’m kind of jealous of how good of a driver you are. So careful, mind set. Yet careless at the same time as you play your music and sing along at times. Sometimes you even sing when we talk on the phone and you think that I can’t listen to you, but I do and damn what I would do to listen to that again and again”

“Oh my god, you know?” You said, facepalming yourself as you drove out of your neighborhood. 

“I do” He laughed drunkenly. “It’s beautiful though. At the other hand, my driving is awful”

“I second that” You laughed. “What I like is that drunk, you are as eager to talk as when you are while sober”

“Girl, I could talk for ages,” He said. “With you especially”

“Mhm,” You said as you turned to a corner. You sighed as you spotted the Taco Bell drive through and drove towards the line. Who are you kidding, there is no line at this time. It’s after 5 am. “Hold on,” You told Namjoon as you pulled at the drive through and placed your finger over the speaker so that he doesn’t hear you order. 

“Hello, what would you like to order?” The man asked from the speaker.

“Hi, can I get three chicken soft tacos, one small fries, one diet coke, and an unsweetened ice tea? Thanks” You ordered and drove a little further. You kept your finger on your speaker until it was time to collect your order and hoped that Namjoon wouldn’t listen. You paid and thanked the cashier quietly, getting no weird looks, surprisingly.

People are too used to drunk teenagers eating at this time. You placed the bag on the passenger’s seat and left your phone right beside it. “Who were you talking to?”

“Nobody”

“Ugh, are you here yet? I’m bored. This party was boring enough without you. Also, I hope nobody saw me wink at Sunmin and then kiss a random girl in beer pong” He giggled.

Your lips formed a straight line as you let the silence fall to collect your thoughts. He kissed a random girl, during a game. You told yourself you were over this stupid crush of yours on your very own guy best friend, yet at the mention of him touching, talking to or kissing another person still made the unsettling feeling in your stomach appear. “I’m almost there. Almost” You sighed.

“Great because I need to pee too,” He said. “What if I pee in this bucket? It fell on me when I hit my head, might as well use it!”

“Namjoon, no!” You said. “Don’t pee in that bucket you asshole”

“But I need to!” He said.

“Do not do it. Jungkook will be pissed” You said.

“As if I care what baby Jungkook thinks,” He said.

“Joonie…” You sighed, knowing how to get him to stop.

“Fine” He groaned and you heard him sit back down on the floor. You parked a few meters away from Jungkook’s apartment and took your seatbelt off. You took your phone in your hand and pressed the middle button for it to open.

“Okay, I’ll be there in a second. Don’t do anything stupid and piss me off more okay?” You told him.

“Yes, ma’am. You behave as well. No touching others, no grinding over anyone’s dick and no sucking anyone’s di-”

“Joon! Shut the hell up and let me come take your drunk ass home” You said and ended the call from the rage that he built so quickly. You got off your car, locked it and put your phone in the pocket of your big jean jacket. You stood in front of the bustling apartment, surprised at the number of people still there. You took in a deep breath and a few thoughts popped in your head.

Why are you doing this? You told yourself you were over with his crap. He has been on and off with you lately and yet acts as if nothing has changed. He has used you as a pawn to get back with his ex-girlfriend, that you got him to date in the first place. He hasn’t had time for you lately either, he has always been hanging out with the boys. You were totally fine with them, you were friends with them as well but he has been making up excuses and canceling plans too many times in the duration of the past three months. And it wasn’t only that, he was still touchy feely with you. Even after he broke up, he likes to play with how you react.

He has let himself turn into who he never wanted to be and you didn’t know the reason why. He wouldn’t tell you and you couldn’t find the courage to talk to him about it either. You were always a confrontatial person, but in his case, he made you feel weak. You felt like putty in his hands, easy to manipulate. You always stood your ground, always went off about what you didn’t like, yet when he smiled at you the way he did, you just held an unexplanable grudge. You would never tell him what it was about and he would easily take it away and charm his way into being as playful and affectionate as always.

He wasn’t a bad friend. He was far from that. He was the perfect friend if that existed. He had his flaws, but the good parts always shined. He was even an amazing person that a lot of people looked up to and you could see why. Yet when you get to know one person, you get to know more of the flaws, the cracks, the insecurities. All of it.

“Yo, Y/N! Jesus christ, how hard are you zoning out?” Jimin laughed at your face as he waved his hand in front of your eyes. 

“Jimin” You let out a breath you didn’t know you were holding. You smiled at the sane sight of your good friend and ex-boyfriend. “Sorry”

“It’s serious if you are zoning out this hard,” He said. “Last time you zoned out like this was when we broke up. Then you broke down, kissed me and smiled like a psycho”

You rolled your eyes at him. “Two years ago. It was a whole two years ago, Jimin”

“What are you doing here? I thought you were too mad at Joon to come” He nudged your shoulder teasingly.

If one person knew you entirely like an open book, it was Jimin. It was admirable how you two never kept secrets. Even with Namjoon, you two weren’t completely transparent. That is how Jimin and Y/N have always been. Raw, honest, stripped down. That’s why your relationship ended so smoothly. You worked better as good friends and you both knew it, so you made the mutual decision. As if it was possible, you became even more close from that day. 

“Yeah well… He called”

“Just like that” He nodded. “Have you really become this soft for him?”

“I guess” You shrugged. “I even brought him food because he said he was hungry,” You said, shaking your head as you looked down at your boots.

“He’s locked in the closet next to Jungkook’s room,” He told you.

“I’m very aware” You nodded and laughed. “Why did they do it?”

“You know how the two babies love to fuck with Joon when he’s drunk. He’s vulnerable. They literally told him that you were in that closet, so he got in and they locked him” He explained. “He really wanted you here” He looked at you, lowering his head so that he can grab your attention and make you stop looking at the ground.

“I don’t care” You shook your head and looked up, swallowing. “I just know that Jin might never get him home if he’s drunk too. He’ll be mad at himself if he doesn’t wake up in his bed tomorrow”

“You don’t care, yet you go out of your way to come all the way across town, almost at dawn to get him home safely,” He said, propping his eyebrow. “Of course you don’t care hun”

“Jiminie I-”

“You know you can’t lie to me” He stated. “You need to tell him how you feel. I know you think it will be stupid and that he will hate you after it, but he’s changed a lot ever since you made that pact to pretend to be his girlfriend so that he can get Sunmin back”

“I don’t even get how people believe it,” You said. “We don’t even kiss!”

“They don’t need to see you kiss to believe it, Y/N. Everyone thought you two were dating from day one, you know that. You know why? Because of that stupid way Joon always looks at you. Well if they happen only in movies, Namjoon is the perfect candidate to play in one because he does it well” He said, trying to change your mind.

“I don’t want to look weak, Jimin,” You said.

He furrowed his eyebrows and shook his head in confusion. “I’m sorry but when did expressing your feelings make you look weak? It makes you honest. I thought you knew how to do that, I thought you were done with being fake”

“I’m not doing it,” You said, crossing your arms in front of your chest. “At least not today. Not until I am sure”

“You will be sure when you end up with seven cats that you will name after us when you turn 70″ He laughed and ruffled your hair. 

“Better late than never” You shrugged.

He rolled his eyes at you and giggled, swinging his arm around your shoulders. He placed a kiss on the top of your head and squeezed you tightly against him in reassurance. “Let’s get you inside. You’re never going to make it upstairs without me. If I let you go alone, you might just end up in a jail cell for punching someone to death”

“Is my hate for drunk teenagers dancing at parties too obvious?” You asked as you took your first steps towards the apartment entrance.

“When you’re sober it is. When you are drunk, you are the annoyance itself’ He teased you with a wide smirk.

“Hey! I like to party, but by my own rules” You said.

“You always are so bossy. Maybe that’s why we didn’t work out. You really do need Joon to dick you down and dom your whiny ass” He smirked harder.

You punched his shoulder and laughed. “I really hate you”

“I love you too, baby!” He yelled over the music.

You really went the route of wearing the skirt Joon told you to wear just to mess him up a little. You received a few quick greetings from Hoseok and Yoongi, Hoseok drunk dancing on top of the coffee table in the living room along with Jin and Jimin helped you pass through the crowd to walk into the kitchen where he knew Jungkook and Taehyung would be, filling up their cups with more alcohol.

As soon as Jimin released his grip from your hand and you walked in front of your two friends, they stopped drinking, their eyes as wide as an owl’s. “Which one of you fuckers had the brilliant idea?”

Jungkook gulped down and stuttered. “I- I uh I didn’t! It was Taehyung!”

“Liar!” Taehyung exlcaimed and hit Jungkook on his chest. “It was your idea. I don’t want my balls cut off by Y/N. I want to have chldren. You’re doomed to never find a wife, I’m not!”

“You’re such an asshole, I swear to god” Jungkook rolled his eyes at Taehyung. As amusing as it was to hear them argue, trying to cover up their little plan, you wanted to get to the point.

“How long has it been?” You asked.

“An hour? I think more. He might have died” Jungkook said.

“Well, you’re a dick and it is a proven fact from now on. Brilliant idea, never do it without me again. But do it for a good reason!” You protested. “You can’t go around and push my relationship with Joon like that. It’s uncalled for”

“We just wanted to fuck with him, I’m sorry” Jungkook pouted.

“Next time you want to know something about us two, just ask me and don’t manipulate Joon. Because I know you did it to prove a point” You said.

“Which is that Joon wants your babies,” Taehyung said. “He called you, mission accomplished. Just date for real, it’s tiring”

“You think it’s not tiring for me either?!” You yelled out of frustration. “I’m sorry. I’m not having the best day. He was rambling on the phone and I don’t know what to believe anymore. I’m going to go get him”

“Relax. You’re just taking him home” Jimin said as you walked out of the kitchen.

“I know” You let out a sigh. “You can go now” You smiled at him.

“Text me if anything happens” He kissed your cheek one last time and left you be.

You took in a deep breath and quickly walked up the stairs. Namjoon was the only one that hadn’t noticed your feelings at this point. Every one of the boys and your girl friends knew. They were also the only people that knew your relationship was just staged. He was such a smart person, his intelligence and his way of understanding everyone around him was admirable, nevertheless, he couldn’t decipher your mind entirely and it drove you insane. You just wished he could see it with his own eyes, make his conclusion and ask you if it is true. The thought of uttering those words to him was simply terrifying.

Your feet navigated you through the apartment and you knew exactly where that closet was. You remember back a year ago when you were at another party of Jungkook’s.
