Unfortunately, you blew your plan when Jimin started tickling you and you started laughing hysterically.

The corners of your lips curled up into a small smile, however, it quickly fell off your pink stained lips and formed a small frown as you prepared yourself to unlock the door to the closet. You had to do this and you had to be cold and quick with it. No having fun, there are limits in your actions. At least there should be, even if you keep them or not.

You twisted the golden key Jungkook had given you and unlocked the door, opening it slowly. You turned the lights on, which were off the whole time and Namjoon squinted his eyes, hissing. “Ouch!”

“Get up,” You told him, your arms crossed in front of your chest.

He opened his eyes and stood up carefully, his palm on the wall to help him steady his vulnerable drunken state. “You took your sweet time coming here”

Your eyes widened as you realized, his hair was no longer black. His smooth black hair has suddenly become a dirty blond colour, which somehow complimented his recently tanned skin tone perfectly. “You- You’re blond?”

“You like it?” He grinned widely. “We made a bet with the guys! So I did it”

“I swear to God, you are such an idiot” You rolled your eyes and breathed in, taking a whiff of a terrible smell. You squinted your eyes in disgust and pinched your nose with your index finger and your thumb. “What is that smell?”

“As I said, you took your sweet time. I couldn’t hold it back any longer!” He whined.

“Oh my god, did you seriously pee in the bucket?” You asked, surprised.

“Wanna see?” He asked.

“No!” You shook your head. “Let’s just get out of here. The ones who started this mess in the first place can handle it”

Namjoon giggled and as soon as he walked out, you locked the closet again and pushed Namjoon towards the bathroom across the hall. “First you clean your hands and then we can leave”

“You act worse than my mother, Jesus Y/N” He rolled his eyes. He did as you said and proceeded to clean his face with some water. Surprisingly enough, he could walk perfectly even if he is drunk. Maybe, just maybe the alcohol was starting to wear off of him.

This is your chance Y/N. Leave him here and act as if you never came the next day. You can’t let him sober up and then have him tease you for the rest of the year. What if you start talking in the car and he gets his logic back and you confess something you don’t want him to know? Maybe you’re being overdramatic. He can’t sober up this fast.

You quickly gave Jungkook his key back and tried to get Namjoon out of the party. He followed you behind and you caught Jimin’s stare, gesturing you to call him if anything goes wrong. So many things could go wrong.

You got Namjoon safely at the back seat of your black SUV and made your way to the driver’s seat. You made sure to get out of the drive way as quickly as possible, not wanting to give any more attention to yourself. You don’t want anyone talking about your cameo appearance in campus tomorrow. That is actually the last thing you want.

“Does it smell like food in here?” He asked. He popped his head up from the back seat and his eyes darted to the recyclable Taco Bell paper bag on the passenger’s seat. “You got me food?! God, Y/N I love you” His lips left a quick kiss on your cheek as he hugged you from behind. He is so lucky you are a good driver, otherwise, you could have ended up hitting a tree from his sudden display of affection.

You decided to park your car at the Taco Bell parking lot, which wasn’t far from your own apartment. You parked at a secluded corner and took in a deep breath after you shut the engine off. “You can come to the front now”

Like a child getting what it wants, Namjoon climbed out of the back seat and opened the door to the passenger’s seat. You took the paper bag in your hands and set it in the middle of the both of you, taking your iced tea out. The only thing that could calm you down at this point is tea. Everything else seems too uncertain to give you reassurance.

“Ahh” Namjoon exclaimed as soon as he took the first bite out of his taco. “You even got my favourite”

“Just eat and shut up,” You said, taking the fries out of the bag. You put your music playlist on, the chill song that came on softly playing in the background of the silence between you and him.

You were surprised at how quickly he devoured all three tacos and downed his coke like it was water. You were just about done with one small fries and sipped on your last few drops of tea. 

Namjoon sat back and rubbed his stomach with a smile on his face. “Thanks”

“Yeah,” You said, looking out of the window. As you looked at the first few cars passing by so early in the morning, you felt Namjoon’s hand on your thigh, playing with the edge of your skirt. His favourite skirt. “Ah, look at you. You really wore it?” 

You avoided his stare at all costs. His stare when sane and sober might be deadly, but his drunken stare is inviting and that is all the more worse. It’s too easy for you to manipulate. You could steal your chance and do anything you wanted right about now. You have thought about it plenty of times, so why not do it now? “Yeah. I wore it”

He smiled gently, his dimples popping out of both of his cheeks as his thumb caressed the exposed skin of your thigh. He shuffled in his seat and rested his chin on your shoulder, his breath fanning your neck. A trail of goosebumps rose on your honey skin as his lips made contact with your neck. You took in a sharp shaky breath as his tongue darted out on your skin, taking you by surprise. “I need to get you home”

“Not yet,” He said, placing a delicate kiss. He brought your skin between his teeth and you knew this was getting too far, too fast. You wanted to savor his lips on your body as much as you could, but you knew it wasn’t right. Every time he got too close, sober or not, every time he put his hands on you so innocently, you felt as if he was your Pandora’s box and you felt more and more intrigued, your will rising each time he grazes your thigh, your hand, your cheek, your neck, anything.

You knew opening this box, this mind of his and its twisted ways that are so well masked underneath his perfectly sculpted dimples and piercing dark brown eyes would cause an avalanche of problems to fall on your already hurt shoulders, ready to collapse if more burden is put on them. It’s not like your life is perfect. Your life is far from perfect. People like Namjoon just make it a little less shitty and you don’t want to risk losing that.

You gently pushed Namjoon away and put your hands on the steering wheel, your knuckles turning white from the pressure you put. “Enough”

“What? Why?” He pouted.

“It’s time to sleep” You smiled gently, trying not to show too much of your anger. You turned the engine on and started driving, the familiar road towards the apartment he shares with Jin and Hoseok.

You caught him furrowing his eyebrows from the corner of your eyes, his pretty pink lips opening to speak and you waited for him to utter the first stupid thing that came into his mind, only for his actually logical question to surprise you. “Why are you going this way?”

“I’m going to your apartment. Does alcohol make you an amnesiac as well? That’s new” You kept your eyes focused on the road as the first few cars of people going to work have started making their way into the road.

“I thought I was coming with you. It would be better not to show up like this in the apartment, right?” He asked. “I think Hoseok’s girlfriend will be over too”

“Oh, so I have to baby you for the rest of the day?” You raised your eyebrow at him. He parted his lips to speak, not knowing how to respond and you shook your head. “This is a one-time thing”

“I’ve slept in your apartment before,” He said.

“I mean you, drunk, in my apartment. It’s not happening again” You said.

“It made everyone see how my girlfriend cares about me though” He smiled and giggled, pressing a light kiss on your shoulder.

“Ha, funny Namjoon. Funny” You let out a cold laugh as you turned and pulled into your neighborhood. Your regular parking spot waited for your car to be placed perfectly in front of the door of your apartment, something that always made your perfectionist side feel the most satisfaction it can possibly feel.

At this point, Namjoon was able to walk towards your apartment at his own accord and strengh, which you were grateful for. A few more minutes and he could sober up. You can see he is in this sleepy state that if you keep him up for too long, he might just puke the alcohol out and be himself again.

You practically forced him to sleep on the couch as you didn’t want to wake up next to him in the morning and have to face him. He whined for a few minutes until he passed out. You tucked him in and made your way towards the bathroom to change back into your comfortable pajamas. Even if you felt tired, you tossed and turned on the couch, bothered by the whole situation and finding it unbearable to just let it go. You overthought and analyzed every single day. This night was no different, but it was way more intense.

You need to get over him and stop this madness, Y/N. It’s slowly driving you insane, you thought.

You had really started to think you had gotten over him the past few weeks. All it took to hit you into reality was this night. This sleepless night of procrastination and guilt.

[Sunday, 12:28 pm]

You stepped your foot into the small local coffee shop you and Jimin loved the bell over the door ringing, announcing your presence. You smiled gently as you saw Jimin waiting at the corner booth you always chose to sit at, two cups of cold brew latte, extra ice for you.

“How long have you been waiting?” You asked him as you sat down, not bothering to take your big jean jacket off. It smelled like Namjoon from yesterday, as he had decided to steal it from you at some point while he was in the back seat where you had also left your jacket.

Jimin pushed the cup towards you with a sweet smile and you took your first sip, gladly letting the coffee run in your veins. “Not long, I got here five minutes ago. Don’t worry, all of your precious ice cubes have remained intact”

You smiled like a child getting a brand new strawberry lollipop, a cute toothy smile as you took another sip. You had this weird obsession with eating ice cubes. To be honest, the most exciting part of drinking anything cold was being left with a few drops that coated the ice cubes, to give you a sweet crispy sense in your mouth. “Thanks”

“How’s lover boy doing?” He asked you.

“No idea” You shrugged. “He’s probably still passed out. It was 7 am when we got back”

“Damn, what took you so long? Car sex? I know Namjoon gets even more dominant when he’s drunk, so how are your legs still in place?” He teased you.

You rolled your eyes at him and curled your lips around your straw. “Your humor is especially awful today, Park Jimin. I got him food, we ate it in the parking lot and we left. What took so long was me contemplating to walk into the party in the first place”

“Ah yeah” He laughed. “You looked like a lost puppy. That’s how he makes you look when you think of him”

“Not a good look on me, I hate not knowing shit,” You said. “Can you keep a secret?”

“Are you seriously asking me? You know what, if you are asking it is actually serious” He said, furrowing his eyebrows.

You looked around cautiously, hoping no one that knew you were looking and moved your thick choker to allow him to see the purple hickey on your neck. You weren’t expecting Namjoon’s playful little drunk bites to leave a hickey this dark, yet here you were wearing a choker after months. “Oh, shit,” Jimin said. “And I was wondering why you wore a choker. I thought you dropped them long ago, as they- and I quote- ‘aren’t in fashion anymore’. Can you enlighten me? Did you really eat food? Because it seems to me as if Namjoon went right to dessert”

“Did you get laid last night? Because you seem awfully cheery today” You shot back.

“Yes indeed!” He smirked. “But this is not about me here. This is about your little sexscapade with Namdaddy”

“Would you stop!” You laughed, sending him a death glare. “He just… After we ate, we just sat there, my music was playing and he started being… touchy”

“Sounds like a regular day to me,” He said. “He always does that, Y/N”

“He held my upper thigh, he kissed my neck and he gave me a hickey, Jimin. A freaking hickey” You whispered but yelled at him at the same time. “I know we’re always touchy but… When he called me to tell me he was locked in that closet, I told him I was getting ready and he went on to talk about me and how good my ass would look naked and how he wants to hear my singing again because it is good to him”

“Damn, he went soft on you? And he still doensn’t let himself see how much he likes you?” He asked.

“I’m tired, Jimin. If I confront him about this, he will deny all of it. He might act all mighty and dominant but he’s a coward and I don’t want to risk our friendship. It’s as if I had feelings for your crush and I told you” You said. “I can’t have him be all touchy-feely with me anymore. It adds fuel to the fire and I definitely cannot pretend to be his girlfriend any longer. He told me he kissed a random girl for beer pong and I got jealous”

“He told you that?” He asked, raising both of his eyebrows. He locked his jaw in place and you knew for a fact, he was about to say something big. “Did he leave out the detail that this random girl was actually Sunmin? Did he also forget to tell you that I found him in Jungkook’s room, zipping his pants with Sunmin rushing out?”

Your lips parted and your jaw dropped in surprise. “He was lucky it was nobody else. He really risked his own stupid plan. He has Sunmin being the biggest slut out there and he’s bulding himself a fuckboy title. You two really need to talk, Y/N. I don’t care what exactly you will tell him, but this pact is not good for any of you”

You nodded and bit your lip, breaking an ice cube with your teeth to calm you down. “He cheated on his imaginary girlfriend and then asked for her to pick up his mess. How romantic”

“He was plastered and he doesn’t accept his feelings. Let’s be honest, the way he is handling everything, he’s not going to be acting sane unless you slap some sense into him” He said. “Turn the tables, Y/N. Be the smart one and the one who will sooth your problems. Namjoon might be good with feelings about loving yourself, but he is definitely not good with feelings towards other people”

You nodded again, taking the last sip of your coffee. “What did you do with him anyway?”

“He slept at my place. He slept on the bed, I slept on the couch. Well, I didn’t sleep, I could only get a 30-minute nap. I woke up, got showered, dressed, wrote him a note asking him to be out of my apartment by 1 pm and drove here” You said, biting down on your lip, a habit you always found solace in when you felt guilty or giddy. “I let him use the shower though”

Jimin laughed and smiled at you, shaking his head at your cute way of trying to stay mad at Namjoon.

[Thursday, 17:04 pm]

You made your way out of your college campus, finally done with your classes for today and plugged in one of your earphones to listen to your regular music, a coping mechanism for you. Whenever your feelings get all distorted or too intense, you have found music to work the best in calming you down. Nevertheless, the song that came on shuffle in your chill playlist didn’t exactly help with keeping your mind quiet.

Why did Ariana Grande have to make such relatable songs?!, you thought.

You walked out, your feet carrying you towards the parking lot until more students started to come out and a familiar face caught your attention. You locked eyes and you cursed under your breath. This has been a confrontation you have been avoiding for as many days as you could, even if you promised Jimin you would be done with it very soon. 

Your pace quickened as you saw Namjoon walk towards you. Why did he have to wear that flowy blue and white shirt? All you want to do is take it off of him. He even paired it with a grey beanie. The things he does to you with solely his sense of fashion are incredible.

Focus, Y/N.

He picked up your pace and started walking beside you. You raised your hand with your other earphone in hand, but he caught your wrist so that you can’t plug it in. He wrapped his arm around your shoulders with a smile on his face and placed a peck on your cheek. “Where has my lovely girlfriend been the whole week while everyone was thinking how good we looked together at the party?”

“Doing important things, now could you let me breathe? I’d appreciate it” You said. Of course, he wants you only for this publicity stunt.

“You’ve been ignoring me ever since the party. What’s wrong with you lately? You kick me out of your apartment with a note and then give no shits about me?” He said. “I thought we were on the same page here”

“We are. I picked you up from the party. Isn’t that enough Namjoon?” You asked. He stepped in front of you and put his hands on your shoulders, stopping you from walking any further. “I need to be at work by 6″

“Call in sick,” He said.

“Are you kidding me? I make a living out of that intership, I can’t lie” You said.

“Then I’ll do it,” He said, snatching your phone from your hands. He unplugged your earphones, making the music stop and you saw him search for the call app.

“Hey, give it back!” You protested, trying to take it away from him. Namjoon blocked your small frame by placing his arm in front of your chest and dialed the number of your work with his free hand. He put the phone next to his ear and placed his index finger in front of your plump lips to silence you.

“Hi, I’m calling on behalf of Y/N L/N, I’m her boyfriend. Nice to meet you too. Yeah, she can’t be present today as she is sick. Yeah she has the flu, you know, from all the iced drinks she has every day” He laughed lightly and your eyes threw darts towards him. “Careless Y/N. She’s extremely sorry. Oh yes, thank you! I will tell her that. Thank you very much, have a nice day” He smiled and ended the phone call. Without a warning, he shot you a cold smile as he put your phone in the back pocket of his jeans. “You’re not getting it back until I say so. Your tricks of putting music on as a way to stop listening to me are over”

“This is a violation of my privacy!” You protested. He rolled his eyes from your loud demeanor and pulled you towards a hall, where nobody could hear you. “What are you doing?! I don’t need to talk right now Namjoon”

“Don’t whine. I scored you a sick leave from today until Sunday, be grateful” He said. 

“I don’t need a sick leave, I’m not sick! You make me sick, not a disease. But you know what? You’re just like a disease. You stick on people and only leave if you kill it. And that is my last solution so guess who’s going to end up dead by the end of this sick leave” You smiled coldly.

“Stop being a child,” He said. “You came to the party”

“And you peed in a bucket, what’s your point?” You asked, shrugging.

He furrowed his eyebrows and squinted his eyes in complete confusion. “I did?” He asked. “Y/N, this is not the point! You came to the party when you said you wouldn’t. Why?”

“You called me and you were drunk. Unfortunately, I’m the only person that you act sane around when drunk so I couldn’t leave you to the others to handle. I needed to come” You said. “It doesn’t mean anything”

“What happened? It didn’t really look good for you to show up, drag me out and then make no contact with me until today” He said. “And that song you posted on your Instagram story a couple of days ago? Better off without him? What the fuck Y/N? Everyone thinks we broke up”

“So what? This doesn’t look good, that doesn’t look good, nothing looks good lately. Well seems like I’m not good enough for the fake girlfriend part” You shrugged, ignorant of his ego. “Maybe I’ll fabricate a good break up story for you. Like, Namjoon breaks up with current girlfriend because he cheated on her with his ex or something like that” You shot.

He was left dumbfounded, his lips parted as he gulped down nervously. “W-what?”

“What? I’m fabricating stories. Although I’m surprised with how well everyone is hiding from me the fact that you kissed some random girl during beer pong. Maybe it was because they were plastered and have probably forgotten about my existance. They always do” You said.

“I didn’t kiss anyone” He lied.

“You called me and told me yourself, Namjoon. But I mean it’s fine as long as your image is not destroyed, right?” You smiled, a fake smile. You felt so done with his shit and all of his plans to keep his image clean in order to get what he wants. You could seriously punch him at this point and not be sorry for it at all.

“Okay, okay. This is awfully confusing” He shook his head.

“It’s confusing, huh? Have you ever thought how goddamn exhausting it might be for me as well? Pretending when I’m only just finding myself. It’s quite of a let down when the person who helped you find yourself in the first place is the one who made you lose it in mere seconds as well” You said.

“I- Then what the hell are you implying? That we should break up?” He asked. 

“We might as well do. We might as well do, in all meanings. I need closure Namjoon. I don’t want you in my life anymore if you’re going to let me get lost in my own thoughts and guilt again. You helped me break down my walls and now you’re just giving me the bricks to rebuild it” You said. “But you just won’t let me,” You said. Your voice was getting weaker than before and you could feel your eyes water and your cheeks heat. It has been such a long time ever since you last cried and so many emotions have built inside you for the past week, that maybe giving up and accepting to talk to him wasn’t the best idea for your mental stability.

You crossed your arms in front of your chest and bit your lip, trying not to let yourself slip from your own hands as you looked around for any passersby. “I never knew I made you feel this way”

“Well, living behind a mask and building an ego as high as yours can do that, surprisingly” You laughed coldly. “Let me breathe, Namjoon”

“I- You can’t just leave me. You have been away from me for days, isn’t that enough? For me it seemed like an eternity of trying to get a minute alone with you” He said.

“It hurts, doesn’t it? Wanting to get that attention, to feel that sort of affection from someone, but he or she just gives it to anybody but you? Sucks to be you, really” You said. Your anger boiled and you felt a knot tie at the pit of your stomach. “I’m sorry I have been neglecting your needs of being the cover for you to be a fuck up. I don’t think being a fuckboy is really the image you want right now, is it?”

“Whatever you are saying makes no sense to me whatsoever” He shook his head, huffing. “You’re acting as if we really are dating. If you want to change the rules of the pact just let me know. Did you change your mind on the no kissing policy? We can change that you know, I never understood why kissing was forbidden in the first place. Sometimes I feel like you are in love with me or something” He snorted.

You burst out laughing, not able to hold it in anymore. Doesn’t he understand how badly he has damaged himself? How much his plan has changed him. He can’t even think properly anymore. All he does is lie and deny each and every one of his mistakes. “Do you really think lying will get you anywhere? I am doing you a favor here Namjoon. A bloody favor is what leaving you is. You got what you wanted, you got Sunmin back. You never even lost her, you always had her and that is why it was so easy to get her into bed with you. I’m only an obstacle for you now”

“You-”

“Don’t even try to lie about it anymore. Jimin told me he walked in on you after you were done, in Jungkook’s bedroom” You said.

He closed his eyes and took in a deep breath, streching his hands at the back of his head. He hit his fist on the wall out of frustration. “Dammit!”

“What are you so frustrated for? You were planning to keep it a secret from me forever?” You asked.

“I wasn’t planning on letting that happen in the first place. I wasn’t planning on getting shit faced either, you know. But that’s who I am when you’re not there. Having to baby your drunk ass is way more fun you know” He smiled, guilt in his smile. “Sleeping with Sunmin was… it was just as if I had sex just to not be frustrated anymore, but look what I did now! I thought that if I slept with her I would get my head back in the game and stop wanting to mess everything up, but it made it worse”

“What are you frustrated for, exactly? Your life is freaking perfect! You have so many amazing friends, you have girls running behind you all the time, Sunmin never stopped wanting to be the slut she is with you” You said. “Not to brag, but you also got the priviledge of making me feel bad. I’ve kind of heard making Y/N feel like a waste of life is very fun. Sunmin knows that”

He took in a deep breath and nodded to himself. “I thought she had changed”

“People don’t change just like that, Joon. And they definitely do not regret their actions easily if they have an ego as big as hers” You said. “You know, I only agreed to this pact because I thought it would take no time for it to be over with. Just a sweet little torture. Since Sunmin hates my guts, I thought she would get mad and want you back right away. I also only want to see you happy, which is what she made you feel like. I thought she changed myself, I thought she started becoming a better person, but the fact that she slept with you at that party, the party she knew for a fact I wasn’t going, means she hasn’t changed one bit. She keeps hurting me even after two years and now she made you hurt me too” You said.

“Y/N-”

“No, let me speak. I have the right to speak” You said. “I never understood why you dated her in the first place. You were the one to pull me out of the hole she threw me in and I thought you were on my side. The angry one. But then you told me you met her, talked to her at a party and you thought she seemed nice. It was a year after she hurt me. Naturally, the stupid girl I am, I believed you. Only because I missed her. It is true that you can be mad at someone and miss them at the same time, Namjoon. You two just seem to get that out of me. She made you happy when you dated and I felt as if… as if this girl’s purpose was to just take away from me all I love, constantly. She was my best friend. Then she took that away from me and she also took you from me”

“I let her take me,” He said, shaking his head. “I- I acted like I was naive”

“You were” You smiled. “But she has that power, to seem as if she has changed and then turn into the two-faced person she is. I agreed to the pact because I thought I would finally get my best friend back. Yet she still seemed to be the only thing you talked about. We never talked about me anymore and I had to take care of myself on my own. But I also got so obsessed with playing your girlfriend and making sure you were happy that I forgot what I actually wanted”

“I’m sorry,” He said. “It’s worse than you think it is, Y/N. I- Sunmin just helped me open my eyes but you know that sometimes I get lost too. Sometimes I am selfish and put myself first. I thought that if I got back with her maybe everything would be normal again”

“You should have told me, Namjoon. You know for a fact that just because I have depression, just because I used to want to end it all doesn’t mean I am some delicate flower. You can talk to me. You can tell me how you feel” You said. “I am even more mad at you for not opening up”

“If I talked to you, I would have lost you” He shook his head. “I saw how eager you were into helping me get Sunmin back, I got it as a message that that is all you wanted. For me to date someone else. I kind of used you in a way. I did initially want Sunmin back but falling into the routine of acting as if we were together felt good and for a moment I forgot about her. It felt… refreshing to not be suffocated with the thought of her. Because that’s how it feels when I’m with you. You know that feeling? When sometimes, when things are a certain way, it feels as if everything has fallen into place?”

“I know how it feels” You nodded. “I just don’t think you are healthy for me anymore, Namjoon. Jimin thinks that too. Everyone can see it, besides you”

“Can see what?” He asked, clueless over the fact that you are head over heels for your own best friend.

“That-” You took in a deep breath. “Jimin told me… He told me that everyone can see how we feel about one another but us. He said you have that ‘look’ on your face. That look someone has when they are whipped for someone. The look that always makes you smile when we watch KDramas together. When the guy looks at the girl with hearts in his eyes or whatever”

He laughed lightly and nodded, licking his lips. “Do I?”

“How can I know?! I’m just a naive girl that- never mind. Let’s leave it at that” You said.

“I want to change something in our rules for the pact,” He said, clearing his throat. The moment you thought he understood you, he brought up the pact again.

“You… What?”

“I want to erase the no kissing rule,” He said.

“Why?” Your eyes widened.

“I want to know…” He took a step further. “I want to confirm how whipped I am” He smiled cheekily. His dimples popped, perfectly carved into both of his cheeks as always. He held your chin with his index finger and as your eyes were locked on his lips, you forgot what he even told you. 

“Okay stop” You shook your head, seeing as this was getting out of hand. “You can’t be touching me like this anymore!”

“What? Like what? Did you hear what I told you?” He asked.

“Like - like we’re an item! Or you can’t look at me like you want to undress me and eat me for dessert. And when I told you I don’t want you drunk around me anymore, I meant it! You told me you wanted to see me naked and you can’t do that!” You started stomping up and down in front of him, trying to shake away the thought of his lips. His lips on your neck, his hand on your thigh, his eyes sinking into yours and your skin melting under his fingertips. “I’m supposed to be getting over you!”

Namjoon raised his brows and laughed. “Did you just think out loud?”

“I- I- No!” You shook your head. “I’m playing the fake girlfriend” You lied. “As the fake girlfriend, I think you are a bad kisser so I don’t want to kiss you”

“You know, Jimin is right. We’re goddamn blind and in your case, you are deaf too” He said. Namjoon took your hands and stopped you in front of him for what seemed like the tenth time today.

“Excuse you! My senses are great!”

“Yet when I told you I want to see how whipped I am for you, you hear nothing” He giggled.

Your lips parted and you looked at him dumbfounded. “Uh… what? Pft! Of course, I heard that. God, you’re such a good actor”

“God Y/N, stop it” He shook his head. “Answer this question for me. Why in the world, when you have all you want in front of you, you just let it go? You always put others first. Be a little selfish and kiss me”

For a moment you thought you were hallucinating for real. You thought you were dreaming or reading one of your own awful works. But it was him, right in front of you, asking you to break the number one rule you had set months ago. You’ve never wanted to be a rebel more in your life and you took your chance. You grabbed the collar of his shirt and crashed his lips against yours. You stood on your tip toes, the height difference between the two of you immense. A smile formed on Namjoon’s lips but it didn’t break the kiss, it even made it better.

He grabbed your waist and lifted you up. You wrapped your legs around his waist and he secured you by pushing you against the maroon brick wall. It is one thing to imagine how kissing him would feel like and another how it actually felt in reality. No, kissing him didn’t seem like a dream. It felt like it completed all that has been happening for years now. Like it justified how you acted with one another.

You smiled throughout the kiss and were eventually the one to break it, as you giggled from the fact that Namjoon had to lift you up so you could kiss. “I’m sorry! I couldn’t help it. Jesus Christ, I can’t even reach your face Joon!”

“You’re tiny and I love it” He smirked.

“Hey!” You pouted. “Don’t act as if this saved everything. You have a lot to make up for”

“Mhm. I know” He said. “But I have four days of you to myself to fix it since you don’t have to go to work” His lips pulled into a cheeky grin and you playfully smacked his arm.

“You’re unbelievable,” You said. He looked down at you, caressing your cheek with his thumb. He placed a strand of hair behind your ear and his eyes traveled towards your neck.

“Ha. Seems like the hickey I gave you wasn’t that bad anyway. I should make up for that” He said.

Your eyes widened at his words. How did he know that he gave you a hickey? “Did- How do you remember?”

“Let’s just say that all I did after we ate, was of my own accord”

trail.content:
Everytime [best friends au]

Kim Namjoon x female reader

Genre: Angst, Fluff

Word Count: 10.2k

Rating: Mature

Warnings: Mentions of sex, mental health issues, alcohol, swearing.

Description: Helping your best friend and making him happy was always what you strived to achieve. Even if it meant faking to be his girlfriend to get back with his ex, even if it meant his ex was your ex-best friend and even if it meant you were utterly in love with him, trying your best to get over him- or maybe not.

AU: One night I felt motivated and started working on this. Some things are based on my own life, my own feelings, and relationships. I hope I delivered with this story!

[Saturday, 04:53 am]

Your fingers trailed over the black keyboard of your laptop as you typed in meaningless words, saving each and every one on your Word. Your eyes flew to the clock at the bottom of your laptop screen and it read 04:53 am. You sighed at the time and how fast it had passed by, but continued regardless. This was your Saturday night, most of them were like this. Even most of your normal days ended up like this. You sitting on your bed with your laptop on your legs, only the light from the screen illuminating your face, your headphones plugged in to keep any sound away.

A strand of hair fell in the middle of your face and you blew it off only for it to fall back down. You placed it behind your ear and continued your work, only for another distraction to pop up. Your phone buzzed beside you, the screen opening. Your eyes darted to it and as soon as you saw Namjoon’s image displayed, you picked it up, eyebrows scrunched together in confusion.

You just stared at the screen for a mere second, contemplating on whether you should pick up or not. You were already boiling at him having the nerve to call so late at night. Wasn’t he supposed to be at a party right now? You were more than sure he had invited you as well, on Wednesday, and you had turned him down because you were mad at him. It was Jungkook’s party but he would understand. Now Namjoon, on the other hand, was just as pissed as you were, as his own best friend turned him down.

You rolled your eyes and sighed, swiping right. “Hello?”

“Y/N! Babe, finally! What took you so long?” He asked. His voice sounded huskier than usual.

“What do you want?” You asked, coldly.

“Why so harsh? I’m hurt” He said and laughed. “I’m drunk”

“Thanks for telling me? If this is a stupid drunk call, then you’re wasting my time” You told him.

“The boys were asking for you. I’m at the party you were supposed to come, remember?” He said. “But of course, you had better things to do than to hang out with your best friend”

“By hanging out, you mean trying to play matchmaker so that you can get back with Sunmin? No thanks, Joon. I’ll pass this time and all the other times you want me to get her to be jealous for you”  You went off. You knew this wasn’t the right time to talk to him about your thoughts, yet you also knew that you weren’t going to find any courage to do this while he was sober.

“I wanted you here, I invited you, not her. If I wanted to invite her, I would have done it” He said. “Jungkook and Taehyung locked me in a closet”

“They- What? Why?” You asked, laughing.

“Don’t laugh! I can barely see!” He said. “I have no idea”

“Okay, well. Bye” You said, ready to hang up.

“Wait!” He yelled. “Come get me. I’m drunk, remember?”

“You’re not a child. Jin will drive you home” You said.

“I want you! Y/N, my baby girl. Just come to daddy, dammit!” He said.

You chuckled and shut off your laptop. “You are shit drunk, Joon. I’m only coming because you’re stupid when you’re drunk and it doesn’t happen often”

“I are not stupid!” He complained.

“Wow, apparently you forget your grammar too,” You said, putting him on speaker so that you can throw some clothes on. You can’t show up at a party with literally your underwear and a robe around you. You couldn’t give less shit about how you looked, but you didn’t want to go practically naked. Although most of the whores there are naked at this point.

You heard a loud thud from the other line, more than sure Namjoon has hit his head somewhere. Somehow, he is even more clumsy when he is drunk. If you don’t show up in the next twenty minutes, he could even set the closet on fire without knowing how he did it. “I hit my head” He announced as if you hadn’t just heard. “Talk to me!” He whined. “What are you doing?”

“Shut up and stay still. I’m getting dressed to come there” You said.

“Oh,” He said, his tone lower. “You could always come naked, you know? It’s always a sight to see you in your underwear, it will be even better with no clothes. I bet. Wear that dark blue skirt you have, you know, the one that always makes your ass pop even more and has everyone wondering how better it might be exposed”

You almost choked at your own spit at his sudden reveal. You didn’t know people had that opinion for you and what was more surprising was Namjoon’s opinion about you. He’s drunk and talking nonsense, you thought. “You really are a piece of work. And I thought you would be more responsible alone at a party. Usually, I am the one who gets drunk and you are the one who drags me home, you know”

“See what happens when you leave me alone?” He sighed. “I’m useless”

“I told you not to get drunk,” You said, putting your combat boots on. You laced them up and fixed your hair in the mirror, letting your natural soft curls fall down your shoulders- but reaching just there and not longer. You loved having your hair short. It wasn’t exactly a bob and it wasn’t considered long either. The length was just perfect. When you shot the idea that you wanted to cut your hair to your friends, they kept telling you how you should leave your hair get even longer because it suits you. Long dark hair, for a petite curvy figure in her 20s. Fits just right for their stereotypes.

But not for you. You’ve wanted this for so long. You still felt so great about your decision and everyone complimented you despite knowing that they don’t like it as much. It made you feel more like yourself, it gave you a sense of confidence no one could understand but you.

“It’s funny” Namjoon interrupted your train of thoughts. You stopped looking at yourself in the mirror and grabbed your phone from your bed. “It’s funny how you acted all mad when you declined my invite to come to this party, yet you still cared for me enough to tell me not to get drunk. Focus, Y/N.

He picked up your pace and started walking beside you. You raised your hand with your other earphone in hand, but he caught your wrist so that you can’t plug it in. He wrapped his arm around your shoulders with a smile on his face and placed a peck on your cheek. “Where has my lovely girlfriend been the whole week while everyone was thinking how good we looked together at the party?”

“Doing important things, now could you let me breathe? I’d appreciate it” You said. Of course, he wants you only for this publicity stunt.

“You’ve been ignoring me ever since the party. What’s wrong with you lately? You kick me out of your apartment with a note and then give no shits about me?” He said. “I thought we were on the same page here”

“We are. I picked you up from the party. Isn’t that enough Namjoon?” You asked. He stepped in front of you and put his hands on your shoulders, stopping you from walking any further. “I need to be at work by 6″

“Call in sick,” He said.

“Are you kidding me? I make a living out of that intership, I can’t lie” You said.

“Then I’ll do it,” He said, snatching your phone from your hands. He unplugged your earphones, making the music stop and you saw him search for the call app.

“Hey, give it back!” You protested, trying to take it away from him. Namjoon blocked your small frame by placing his arm in front of your chest and dialed the number of your work with his free hand. He put the phone next to his ear and placed his index finger in front of your plump lips to silence you.

“Hi, I’m calling on behalf of Y/N L/N, I’m her boyfriend. Nice to meet you too. Yeah, she can’t be present today as she is sick. Yeah she has the flu, you know, from all the iced drinks she has every day” He laughed lightly and your eyes threw darts towards him. “Careless Y/N. She’s extremely sorry. Oh yes, thank you! I will tell her that. Thank you very much, have a nice day” He smiled and ended the phone call. Without a warning, he shot you a cold smile as he put your phone in the back pocket of his jeans. “You’re not getting it back until I say so. Your tricks of putting music on as a way to stop listening to me are over”

“This is a violation of my privacy!” You protested. He rolled his eyes from your loud demeanor and pulled you towards a hall, where nobody could hear you. “What are you doing?! I don’t need to talk right now Namjoon”

“Don’t whine. I scored you a sick leave from today until Sunday, be grateful” He said. 

“I don’t need a sick leave, I’m not sick! You make me sick, not a disease. But you know what? You’re just like a disease. You stick on people and only leave if you kill it. And that is my last solution so guess who’s going to end up dead by the end of this sick leave” You smiled coldly.

“Stop being a child,” He said. “You came to the party”

“And you peed in a bucket, what’s your point?” You asked, shrugging.

He furrowed his eyebrows and squinted his eyes in complete confusion. “I did?” He asked. “Y/N, this is not the point! You came to the party when you said you wouldn’t. Why?”

“You called me and you were drunk. Unfortunately, I’m the only person that you act sane around when drunk so I couldn’t leave you to the others to handle. I needed to come” You said. “It doesn’t mean anything”

“What happened? It didn’t really look good for you to show up, drag me out and then make no contact with me until today” He said. “And that song you posted on your Instagram story a couple of days ago? Better off without him? What the fuck Y/N? Everyone thinks we broke up”

“So what? This doesn’t look good, that doesn’t look good, nothing looks good lately. Well seems like I’m not good enough for the fake girlfriend part” You shrugged, ignorant of his ego. “Maybe I’ll fabricate a good break up story for you. Like, Namjoon breaks up with current girlfriend because he cheated on her with his ex or something like that” You shot.

He was left dumbfounded, his lips parted as he gulped down nervously. “W-what?”

“What? I’m fabricating stories. Although I’m surprised with how well everyone is hiding from me the fact that you kissed some random girl during beer pong. Maybe it was because they were plastered and have probably forgotten about my existance. They always do” You said.

“I didn’t kiss anyone” He lied.

“You called me and told me yourself, Namjoon. But I mean it’s fine as long as your image is not destroyed, right?” You smiled, a fake smile. You felt so done with his shit and all of his plans to keep his image clean in order to get what he wants. You could seriously punch him at this point and not be sorry for it at all.

“Okay, okay. This is awfully confusing” He shook his head.

“It’s confusing, huh? Have you ever thought how goddamn exhausting it might be for me as well? Pretending when I’m only just finding myself. It’s quite of a let down when the person who helped you find yourself in the first place is the one who made you lose it in mere seconds as well” You said.

“I- Then what the hell are you implying? That we should break up?” He asked. 

“We might as well do. We might as well do, in all meanings. I need closure Namjoon. I don’t want you in my life anymore if you’re going to let me get lost in my own thoughts and guilt again. You helped me break down my walls and now you’re just giving me the bricks to rebuild it” You said. “But you just won’t let me,” You said. Your voice was getting weaker than before and you could feel your eyes water and your cheeks heat. It has been such a long time ever since you last cried and so many emotions have built inside you for the past week, that maybe giving up and accepting to talk to him wasn’t the best idea for your mental stability.

You crossed your arms in front of your chest and bit your lip, trying not to let yourself slip from your own hands as you looked around for any passersby. “I never knew I made you feel this way”

“Well, living behind a mask and building an ego as high as yours can do that, surprisingly” You laughed coldly. “Let me breathe, Namjoon”

“I- You can’t just leave me. You have been away from me for days, isn’t that enough? For me it seemed like an eternity of trying to get a minute alone with you” He said.

“It hurts, doesn’t it? Wanting to get that attention, to feel that sort of affection from someone, but he or she just gives it to anybody but you? Sucks to be you, really” You said. Your anger boiled and you felt a knot tie at the pit of your stomach. “I’m sorry I have been neglecting your needs of being the cover for you to be a fuck up. I don’t think being a fuckboy is really the image you want right now, is it?”

“Whatever you are saying makes no sense to me whatsoever” He shook his head, huffing. “You’re acting as if we really are dating. If you want to change the rules of the pact just let me know. Did you change your mind on the no kissing policy? We can change that you know, I never understood why kissing was forbidden in the first place. Sometimes I feel like you are in love with me or something” He snorted.

You burst out laughing, not able to hold it in anymore. Doesn’t he understand how badly he has damaged himself? How much his plan has changed him. He can’t even think properly anymore. All he does is lie and deny each and every one of his mistakes. “Do you really think lying will get you anywhere? I am doing you a favor here Namjoon. A bloody favor is what leaving you is. You got what you wanted, you got Sunmin back. You never even lost her, you always had her and that is why it was so easy to get her into bed with you. I’m only an obstacle for you now”

“You-”

“Don’t even try to lie about it anymore. Jimin told me he walked in on you after you were done, in Jungkook’s bedroom” You said.

He closed his eyes and took in a deep breath, streching his hands at the back of his head. He hit his fist on the wall out of frustration. “Dammit!”

“What are you so frustrated for? You were planning to keep it a secret from me forever?” You asked.

“I wasn’t planning on letting that happen in the first place. I wasn’t planning on getting shit faced either, you know. But that’s who I am when you’re not there. Having to baby your drunk ass is way more fun you know” He smiled, guilt in his smile. “Sleeping with Sunmin was… it was just as if I had sex just to not be frustrated anymore, but look what I did now! I thought that if I slept with her I would get my head back in the game and stop wanting to mess everything up, but it made it worse”

“What are you frustrated for, exactly? Your life is freaking perfect! You have so many amazing friends, you have girls running behind you all the time, Sunmin never stopped wanting to be the slut she is with you” You said. “Not to brag, but you also got the priviledge of making me feel bad. I’ve kind of heard making Y/N feel like a waste of life is very fun. Sunmin knows that”

He took in a deep breath and nodded to himself. “I thought she had changed”

“People don’t change just like that, Joon. And they definitely do not regret their actions easily if they have an ego as big as hers” You said. “You know, I only agreed to this pact because I thought it would take no time for it to be over with. Just a sweet little torture. Since Sunmin hates my guts, I thought she would get mad and want you back right away. I also only want to see you happy, which is what she made you feel like. I thought she changed myself, I thought she started becoming a better person, but the fact that she slept with you at that party, the party she knew for a fact I wasn’t going, means she hasn’t changed one bit. She keeps hurting me even after two years and now she made you hurt me too” You said.

“Y/N-”

“No, let me speak. I have the right to speak” You said. “I never understood why you dated her in the first place. You were the one to pull me out of the hole she threw me in and I thought you were on my side. The angry one. But then you told me you met her, talked to her at a party and you thought she seemed nice. It was a year after she hurt me. Naturally, the stupid girl I am, I believed you. Only because I missed her. It is true that you can be mad at someone and miss them at the same time, Namjoon. You two just seem to get that out of me. She made you happy when you dated and I felt as if… as if this girl’s purpose was to just take away from me all I love, constantly. She was my best friend. Then she took that away from me and she also took you from me”

“I let her take me,” He said, shaking his head. “I- I acted like I was naive”

“You were” You smiled. “But she has that power, to seem as if she has changed and then turn into the two-faced person she is. I agreed to the pact because I thought I would finally get my best friend back. Yet she still seemed to be the only thing you talked about. We never talked about me anymore and I had to take care of myself on my own. But I also got so obsessed with playing your girlfriend and making sure you were happy that I forgot what I actually wanted”

“I’m sorry,” He said. “It’s worse than you think it is, Y/N. I- Sunmin just helped me open my eyes but you know that sometimes I get lost too. Sometimes I am selfish and put myself first. I thought that if I got back with her maybe everything would be normal again”

“You should have told me, Namjoon. You know for a fact that just because I have depression, just because I used to want to end it all doesn’t mean I am some delicate flower. You can talk to me. You can tell me how you feel” You said. “I am even more mad at you for not opening up”

“If I talked to you, I would have lost you” He shook his head. “I saw how eager you were into helping me get Sunmin back, I got it as a message that that is all you wanted. For me to date someone else. I kind of used you in a way. I did initially want Sunmin back but falling into the routine of acting as if we were together felt good and for a moment I forgot about her. It felt… refreshing to not be suffocated with the thought of her. Because that’s how it feels when I’m with you. You know that feeling? When sometimes, when things are a certain way, it feels as if everything has fallen into place?”

“I know how it feels” You nodded. “I just don’t think you are healthy for me anymore, Namjoon. Jimin thinks that too. Everyone can see it, besides you”

“Can see what?” He asked, clueless over the fact that you are head over heels for your own best friend.

“That-” You took in a deep breath. “Jimin told me… He told me that everyone can see how we feel about one another but us. He said you have that ‘look’ on your face. That look someone has when they are whipped for someone. The look that always makes you smile when we watch KDramas together. When the guy looks at the girl with hearts in his eyes or whatever”

He laughed lightly and nodded, licking his lips. “Do I?”

“How can I know?! I’m just a naive girl that- never mind. Let’s leave it at that” You said.

“I want to change something in our rules for the pact,” He said, clearing his throat. The moment you thought he understood you, he brought up the pact again.

“You… What?”

“I want to erase the no kissing rule,” He said.

“Why?” Your eyes widened.

“I want to know…” He took a step further. “I want to confirm how whipped I am” He smiled cheekily. His dimples popped, perfectly carved into both of his cheeks as always. He held your chin with his index finger and as your eyes were locked on his lips, you forgot what he even told you. 

“Okay stop” You shook your head, seeing as this was getting out of hand. “You can’t be touching me like this anymore!”

“What? Like what? Did you hear what I told you?” He asked.

“Like - like we’re an item! Or you can’t look at me like you want to undress me and eat me for dessert. And when I told you I don’t want you drunk around me anymore, I meant it! You told me you wanted to see me naked and you can’t do that!” You started stomping up and down in front of him, trying to shake away the thought of his lips. His lips on your neck, his hand on your thigh, his eyes sinking into yours and your skin melting under his fingertips. “I’m supposed to be getting over you!”

Namjoon raised his brows and laughed. “Did you just think out loud?”

“I- I- No!” You shook your head. “I’m playing the fake girlfriend” You lied. “As the fake girlfriend, I think you are a bad kisser so I don’t want to kiss you”

“You know, Jimin is right. We’re goddamn blind and in your case, you are deaf too” He said. Namjoon took your hands and stopped you in front of him for what seemed like the tenth time today.

“Excuse you! My senses are great!”

“Yet when I told you I want to see how whipped I am for you, you hear nothing” He giggled.

Your lips parted and you looked at him dumbfounded. “Uh… what? Pft! Of course, I heard that. God, you’re such a good actor”

“God Y/N, stop it” He shook his head. “Answer this question for me. Why in the world, when you have all you want in front of you, you just let it go? You always put others first. Be a little selfish and kiss me”

For a moment you thought you were hallucinating for real. You thought you were dreaming or reading one of your own awful works. But it was him, right in front of you, asking you to break the number one rule you had set months ago. You’ve never wanted to be a rebel more in your life and you took your chance. You grabbed the collar of his shirt and crashed his lips against yours. You stood on your tip toes, the height difference between the two of you immense. A smile formed on Namjoon’s lips but it didn’t break the kiss, it even made it better.

He grabbed your waist and lifted you up. You wrapped your legs around his waist and he secured you by pushing you against the maroon brick wall. It is one thing to imagine how kissing him would feel like and another how it actually felt in reality. No, kissing him didn’t seem like a dream. It felt like it completed all that has been happening for years now. Like it justified how you acted with one another.

You smiled throughout the kiss and were eventually the one to break it, as you giggled from the fact that Namjoon had to lift you up so you could kiss. “I’m sorry! I couldn’t help it. Jesus Christ, I can’t even reach your face Joon!”

“You’re tiny and I love it” He smirked.

“Hey!” You pouted. “Don’t act as if this saved everything. You have a lot to make up for”

“Mhm. I know” He said. “But I have four days of you to myself to fix it since you don’t have to go to work” His lips pulled into a cheeky grin and you playfully smacked his arm.

“You’re unbelievable,” You said. He looked down at you, caressing your cheek with his thumb. He placed a strand of hair behind your ear and his eyes traveled towards your neck.

“Ha. Seems like the hickey I gave you wasn’t that bad anyway. I should make up for that” He said.

Your eyes widened at his words. How did he know that he gave you a hickey? “Did- How do you remember?”

“Let’s just say that all I did after we ate, was of my own accord”

Everytime [best friends au]

Kim Namjoon x female reader

Genre: Angst, Fluff

Rating: Mature

Even if it meant faking to be his girlfriend to get back with his ex, even if it meant his ex was your ex-best friend and even if it meant you were utterly in love with him, trying your best to get over him- or maybe not.

AU: One night I felt motivated and started working on this. Some things are based on my own life, my own feelings, and relationships. I hope I delivered with this story!

Your fingers trailed over the black keyboard of your laptop as you typed in meaningless words, saving each and every one on your Word. Your eyes flew to the clock at the bottom of your laptop screen and it read 04:53 am. You sighed at the time and how fast it had passed by, but continued regardless. This was your Saturday night, most of them were like this. Even most of your normal days ended up like this. You sitting on your bed with your laptop on your legs, only the light from the screen illuminating your face, your headphones plugged in to keep any sound away.

body:
6 Bullets: Chapter 03

Warnings: Death, violence, blood, suicide, deception, sexual harassment, swearing, angst

Jin’s investigation is well underway now, but you’re still in the dark about most of it.

Word count: 3497

You hear the shouts of orders before the fact even registers with you. You can’t do anything but stand there as worries begin to run through your head, wondering what on earth is going on and if anyone you know - or anyone at all - is hurt. Jin’s name crosses your mind with a pang to your heart, and you fall to your knees,

“Come on, you have to get up! You can’t stop! We need to get you inside now!” Namjoon tells you, nearly shouting over the turmoil behind you. You shake your head, feeling the tears and the weight of your time here suddenly washing over you. Namjoon lets out what sounds like a growl from deep in his throat and he tears off his suit jacket and throwing it over you, as you’d started shaking form worry and shock at some point. The emotions from what you’ve experienced today finally get to you and Namjoon’s voice fades out into the background. Vaguely you feel strong arms around you; you’re not touching the floor; there’s an erratic heartbeat by your ear and you can hear your own breath alongside it. Time passes around you and you barely register Namjoon taking you straight up through the mansion and to Jin’s office. You find yourself gently placed in Jin’s big chair and you immediately curl yourself up.

Jin paces in front of you, back and forth across the length of the office. You can hardly focus on him, because all you want to do is cry. Maybe you are crying, you can’t tell. The weight of everything happening is crushing you, and you can feel it on your shoulders as you bring your knees up to your chest, wrapping Namjoon’s jacket tighter around you. You hear Jin’s voice rise slightly, and you jolt as you try to listen,

“I don’t care what you think, whoever shot here won’t shoot again. We know they’re here, they’ll assume this room is empty,” Jin’s saying to Namjoon, who’s looking at Jin with a steely gaze. You vaguely register the broken window, unable to connect that to the gunshots right now, “I just don’t know how this could have happened. I wasn’t even in here! I’d just left. Why now? That’s the question. If the shots had been just two minutes earlier- wait,” He pauses and you sit up straighter, wondering what he means, “Two minutes,” He mutters, like it holds some grand meaning for him. Jin goes to take another step, but lets out a sound of pure frustration, suddenly barking for Namjoon to escort you to your room for the night.

~~~

30 minutes later, you’re laid on the bed next to Namjoon, wearing a set of the nicer pyjamas that you brought with you. Namjoon’s holding your hand in both of his, gently rubbing his thumb against it as you talk to each other about anything that comes to mind. You stifle a yawn, but Namjoon catches it. He smiles softly and stands up, going to grab two pairs of earphones and a dual jack from his jacket. He places them on the bed before dismissing himself to the bathroom.

He soon re-enters the bedroom, now dressed in loose grey sweatpants and a tight black t-shirt that shows off his arms well. You smile at him and gesture for him to get into bed. He obliges without question, letting you rest your head on his chest as he fusses around with the earphones, so that you can both have two earphones and still share the same music. If anyone who didn’t know you had walked in, they would’ve thought you and Namjoon were together. But no, you’re just so close that neither of you thinks twice about it,

“Let’s just listen to music and sleep. It’s been a long day,” Namjoon murmurs, ruffling your hair before handing you your pair of earphones. You take them with a smile and put them in, feeling sleep creep up on you as Namjoon switches on some calming music and pulls the warm covers over the both of you.

~~~

It doesn’t feel like you’ve slept at all when you hear the gunshot. You’ve heard way too many in the past 24 hours for your liking. You’re upright in an instant, and a quick glance at the clock tells you that it’s 5am. Namjoon is right next to you, hands holding your shoulders as he tugs you a little, trying to get you to lay back down. But you won’t. You’re struggling against his grip, terrified that someone you know got shot. It’s sickening that this sense of fear has struck you before. You try to shove Namjoon off, but he’s not having it,

“Look, just lay down! Jin’s okay, just lay down, please!” He’s begging, but you barely hear over the sound of your own shouts. You’re yelling for anyone you can think of in this house that you care about, wanting to know if they’re okay. Namjoon’s grip tightens on you, finally letting go of his composure as he shoves you down, holding you down by your shoulders as you kick and thrash, screaming for him to get off you. If you’d calmed down for a second, you would’ve seen the disgust written on Namjoon’s face - the disgust at himself for using brute force on you - but you don’t; you just keep screaming and struggling, refusing to stop until you see Jin and Jimin and even Jungkook or V, needing them to be okay.

You have no clue how much time passes before Jin comes in, eyes wide with worry, and suit jacket ruffled like he’d just put it on. At the sight of your brother, you calm down a little. Namjoon lets go of you and you practically fly across the room, throwing yourself at Jin, so glad that he’s okay,

“I thought it was you! Jin, I was so scared, I thought it was you, I thought they came back and tried to finish you off,” You tell him, tears slipping out as you repeat over and over that you thought it was him. You push back from him a little, inspecting him for any damage. That’s when you see the drops of blood on his neck, smudged as if they’d been partially wiped off. You push back completely, looking at him like you barely know him. Jin notices your reaction immediately and shakes his head,

“Please don’t over react, I’ll explain everything if you just calm down. I’m okay. I’m not hurt. I’ll be calling an early meeting with my staff, but I’ll leave V with you. Is that okay?” Jin asks, and you’re almost shocked by his soft tone. He’d actually asked you this time. He hasn’t done that in a long time, so you almost feel bad for what you do next. Almost.

You nod, looking at the floor until you watch Jin move past you to speak to Namjoon. In that moment, you quickly run out of the room, slamming the door behind you. The gunshot came from Jin’s office, and you just know there’s something he’s not telling you. You don’t know why you want to see, but your feet are carrying you up to the office anyway. The security door is carelessly left open, and you don’t bother to ponder that, desperate to reach the office before the two shouting men behind you reach you. You’re almost there, just a few steps away. Jin is yelling at you to not go in, telling you it’s too much for you. You don’t even consider if he’s right before entering.

But he was right.

Blood. Blood is everywhere. You’ve never seen so much of it in your life. It’s dripping down the stark white walls, staining them red. There’s lumps in it, slowly sliding down too - it’s a mix of brain and skull, and you find yourself ready to throw up. Your eyes won’t stop looking though, and they eventually find the crumpled body on the floor, the back of their skull gaping, with more brain matter falling out. As if that isn’t enough, your legs move you forward, turning until you can see the face of the body. When you see his wide, dead eyes, the faint scream still on his lips, the dark hair that’s lost all its bounce, that’s now hanging limply across the messy entry wound on his forehead. Jimin’s forehead,

“What in the hell do you think you’re doing?!” You hear from behind you. Jin’s voice is harsh and barely short of a yell as his rough hands grab you and pull you out of the room, not caring that your feet aren’t leaving the floor. You’re thrown into a seat two rooms over, and Jin’s furious face is all you can see as he continues to yell, “Don’t you ever come up here unless you have explicit fucking permission from me or Namjoon! Do you understand?!”

“Why would I take orders from a murderer?!” You scream right back, finding your voice in the same instant that your eyes find the smeared blood on your brother’s neck for the second time. Jimin’s blood,

“You want to hear about fucking murderers? That man, Park Jimin is a fucking murderer!” Jin yells, his voice doubling in volume as he turns back to slam the door. He tries to continue shouting, but you cut him off, your voice finding a new level of volume that you didn’t realise you had,

“Don’t you talk about him like that, he’s more of a brother to me than you ever have been!” You scream, and that shuts Jin up instantly. The anger visibly drains from his body and his mouth closes as he pulls a chair over so that he can sit in front of you, resting his head in his hands. He rubs his eyes with the heels of his hands,

“I know,” Jin mutters, surprising you. You turn to him and watch him as he takes a deep breath, clearly finding difficulty in continuing, “I know I haven’t done right by you in a long time. But I can’t help it. These people aren’t who they say they are. Jimin was never ours,” Jin tells you, and you frown. Part of you has already supressed the awful image of Jimin’s brains all over the wall just a few metres away so you don’t find it hugely difficult to push it aside in your head and listen to Jin’s words, “He was always Suga’s man. Working on the inside. I used him for discipline and timing things to perfection, but I never asked where he learned it from,” Jin tells you, and you feel out of your depth,

“What do you mean?” You ask, trying to keep your voice calm and soothing. Jin sighs and shifts back, reaching in his trouser pocket to get a small envelope out. He holds it in his hands before continuing, slower and more calculated,

“Suga. Suga’s always been time perfect. I only pieced together the links between Jimin’s obsession with time and Suga’s timely operation after those shots today. And the fact that you smelled his cologne in my office. He’s been sneaking around, under the pretence of being my close friend. Earlier, he brought you to me two minutes early. Had we stayed in that room for two more minutes, you, me, or Namjoon would be dead. His watch is off by two minutes. Do you agree?” Jin asks, watching your face for your reaction. You take a deep breath and nod slowly,

“But why? Jimin has always been there for me. How could he do this to me, and to you, and to Namjoon? I thought he was one of my best friends but…” You trail off, unable to string together anymore words. Jin hands you the photos tentatively, and watches your face as you open them. It’s a small set of polaroid photos, showing Jimin and another man around the same height. He has blonde hair, and he’s pale. They’re both dressed in grey sweatpants and blank tank tops, like the young men you saw training on the grounds yesterday. Jimin looks a lot younger, maybe 15 or 16. The man next to him - Suga - looks a little older, but not by much. You turn to Jin and ask what you’re looking at,

“That’s him and Suga training together. I got them anonymously on my birthday last year. I thought nothing of it at the time - that Jimin was too young to know who that man was, that this was just to mess with my head, but now…” Jin starts, but ends up stopping. You look at him, and see the tears in his eyes. It clicks with you that he’d just killed his best friend and here he is, trying to justify it. You reach out to take his hand, your small hands not covering his, but Jin still feels the comfort in the gesture, “I’m sorry. I haven’t been a good brother at all, but I want you to let me try. I need to brief Namjoon and take care of clean up,” He shivers at the carelessness of his words, but pushes on anyway, “I’ll set aside some time to spend with you as soon as I can. For now, I’ll call for V to stand guard outside your room,”

“Can’t you get him to come inside?” You murmur, averting your eyes as you feel embarrassment creep up your neck and onto your cheeks, “I just lost my brother. I don’t want to be alone,” You say, a whole host of emotions brewing inside of you. At this point, it feels like shock is the only thing keeping you going. Jin nods understandingly and stands up. He pulls out a small flip phone and taps in a few things, hits send and then puts it back in his pocket,

“V will meet you outside the security door,” Jin sighs, pushing his hair back with his hands, “I’m sorry about all of this. I wish you could’ve waited just 6 months to come home, but it’s okay. I think we’re safe now. At least for a little while,” Jin admits, holding his arms out to you. You smile weakly and let him hug you. It feels weird after so long, but it’s oddly comforting. Jin awkwardly pats your shoulder and pulls back, “V should be outside now. I won’t be ages, but I need to talk to Namjoon and make a few calls. Tell V he has permission to enter your room and do whatever it is that he does to calm people down,” Jin tells you before gesturing for you to leave the room. ~~~

Jin beckons Namjoon into the room when he hears the security door buzz shut. He was an idiot to leave it open in the first place. How inconsiderate was it of him to leave it open when Jimin was dead just a few metres away? He had let his emotions get the better of him, and cloud his judgement. But the moment he realised… he just completely lost control. He’d killed people before but never like this. Never in cold blood. Never the second most trustworthy person in his life.

But the fact that he was now closer to his vengeance lit something within him that he knows he won’t be able to stop. He’s had his doubts before, wondering if he’d really be able to go through with it when it came down to it, but this really was the ultimate test for him. He’d thought he could trust Jimin nearly as much as he trusts Namjoon, but he was wrong. He’d had his doubts about Namjoon for a few seconds, but that was impossible. He’d grown up with him. And Namjoon’s a terrible liar anyway.

Namjoon sits on the couch across from Jin, his hair no longer neat. His eyes are red and his breathing isn’t even in any way, but it’s okay. Jin understands why. He sighs and sits back on the couch, trying to come up with a sentence. But he doesn’t have to. Somehow, Namjoon comes up with something first,

“Why Jimin?” He asks. His voice is rough, and Jin can instantly tell that he’s angry. He can’t find it in himself to blame the younger man, “He never did a thing against you and you killed him in cold blood. I trusted you. I did everything you asked of me, and you repay me by killing my best friend. Why Jimin?” Namjoon says again, unable to come to terms with it as easy as Jin has,

“Because he was working with Suga. That’s why Hoseok just agreed to meet with us so easily. Suga knew there were no risks, because Jimin would be here. He ordered Jimin to shoot my office. He wanted us dead,” Jin says, slowly and calmly. He watches Namjoon’s face trying to gauge his reaction,

“Is this to do with your parents?” Namjoon replies simply after about 3 minutes of silence. Jin’s eyebrows raise in response, and leaves a short pause to think of how to phrase his reply. He doesn’t want to tell Namjoon outright what his intentions are, but he doesn’t have much of a choice,

“Yes,”

For a long time he’s been in this business, so it’s not really all that surprising that he can tell who’s got a gun on them and who hasn’t. That’s why Jin doesn’t even try and deny it. He just nods, before going into the pocket of his jacket and pulling out the brass shell of a bullet. It’s a little dull, but otherwise unblemished. Namjoon’s eyes widen in shock, but he doesn’t otherwise react,

“I have 6 of these. One for each person involved with the death of my parents. I want this engraved with Jimin’s name, polished, and put in my glass display case. I’d ask you to do this, but I guess it’s too much. He was your friend and I respect tha- “

“I’ll do it,” Namjoon blurts, cutting Jin off, “I’ll do it if you tell me why his name is going on here. I’ll do all of them, but I need to know why,” Namjoon finishes, his tone strong. He always was good at ignoring his emotions. Jin sighs and places the shell in Namjoon’s open palm. He hadn’t wanted to lay all of his cards out so soon, but if he couldn’t be honest with Namjoon, how could he be honest with himself?

“He was meant to be our guy. Jimin was supposed to be on our side, training to help me when I took over. I was going to call him to help me get through things on the night that I found my parents, but he was already there. I assumed he was in for some late night training, that he’d hidden when things started, and hadn’t come out until he realised it was okay but looking back… he wasn’t even that shaken up. Like he’d expected it. I thought it was good composure, but piecing together what I did today says otherwise. He must have just stood there, or maybe even let their killer in. “I’ll check on V, make sure everything’s okay,” Namjoon says, standing up as he slips the case into his pocket, “I’ll get this engraving done. “Six,” He whispers into the silence.
